question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta are: PHYSICS 1, MATHEMATICS I, GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, GENERAL CHEMISTRY], BIOLOGY, EMBRYOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOLOGY, EMBRYOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY], GENETICS AND MICROBIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL MICROBIOLOGY, GENETICS] and COMPUTER SCIENCE, BIOINFORMATICS AND TECHNICAL-SCIENTIFIC ENGLISH LANGUAGE - INTEGRATED COURSE [TECHNICAL SCIENTIFIC ENGLISH LANGUAGE, COMPUTER SCIENCE AND BIOINFORMATICS, ADO Group of subjects]. integrative subjects for biomedic engineering is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for integrative subjects for biomedic engineering: COMPUTER AIDED DESIGN, ELECTROTECHNICS AND ELECTRONICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ELECTRONICS], ELECTRONICS [ELECTRICAL DEVICES AND CIRCUITS], ELECTRICAL DEVICES AND CIRCUITS, THERMODYNAMICS AND TRASNPORTATION PHENOMENA, SOLID MECHANICS AMD PROPERTIES OF MATERIALS FOR BIOMEDICAL APPLICATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOLID MECHANICS], SOLID MECHANICS [PROPERTIES OF BIOMATERIALS], PROPERTIES OF BIOMATERIALS, BIOMEDICAL EQUIPMENT.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta are: BIOCHEMISTRY, PHYSICS II, HUMAN ANATOMY I, MATHEMATICS II - INTEGRATED COURSE [GEOMETRY, CALCULUS], MEDICAL STATISTICS, BIOPHYSICS, BIOELECTRIC SIGNALS AND BIOMEDICAL DEVICES - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOPHYSICS AND CELL PHYSIOLOGY, BIOMEDICAL DEVICES, BIOELECTRIC SIGNAL PROCESSING] and HUMAN ANATOMY II.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta are: PHYSIOLOGY, ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, GENERAL PATHOLOGY AND IMMUNOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMMUNOLOGY, GENERAL PATHOLOGY], HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS AND PUBLIC HEALTH- INTEGRATED COURSE [HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS MANAGEMENT, HYGIENE], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE - III YEAR and PHYSIOPATHOLOGY, METHODOLOGY AND GENDER MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL PHYSIOPATHOLOGY AND METHODOLOGY, SURGICAL PHYSIOPATHOLOGY AND METHODOLOGY].

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta are: SYSTEMATIC PATHOLOGY  I - INTEGRATED COURSE [BLOOD DISEASES, RESPIRATORY SYSTEM DISEASES, CARDIOVASCULAR SYSTEM DISEASES], SYSTEMATIC PATHOLOGY  II - INTEGRATED COURSE [NEPHROLOGY, UROLOGY], SYSTEMATIC PATHOLOGY  III - INTEGRATED COURSE [GASTROENTEROLOGY, ENDOCRINOLOGY], DERMATOLOGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES - INTEGRATED COURSE [CUTANEOUS AND VENEREAL DISEASES, INFECTIOUS DISEASES], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE - IV YEAR, PATHOLOGICAL ANATOMY, LABORATORY MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY, CLINICAL PATHOLOGY, CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY] and PHARMACOLOGY AND PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [PHARMACOLOGY, ADVANCED PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGIES].

question: What are the subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta are: CLINICAL NEUROSCIENCE, MENTAL HEALTH AND GENDER IDENTITY - INTEGRATED COURSE [NEUROSURGERY, NEUROLOGY, PSYCHIATRY], IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND HUMAN-MACHINE INTERFACES - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, HUMAN-MACHINE INTERFACES], OTHOPAEDICS AND PHYSICAL-REHABILITATIVE MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [LOCOMOTOR SYSTEM DISEASES, PHYSICAL AND REHABILITATIVE MEDICINE], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE - V YEAR, HYGIENE AND INDUSTRIAL MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE, GENERAL AND APPLIED HYGIENE], MOLECULAR AND CLINICAL ONCOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL ONCOLOGY, MOLECULAR PATHOLOGY] and HEAD AND NECK DISORDERS - INTEGRATED COURSE [VISUAL SYSTEM DISEASES, OTORHINOLARYNGOLOGY, ODONTO-STOMATOLOGICAL DISEASES].

question: What are the subjects of the sixth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the sixth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit - caltanissetta are: PAEDIATRICS, OBSTETRICS AND GYNAECOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PAEDIATRICS, GYNAECOLOGY AND OBSTETRICS], FORENSIC MEDICINE, BIOETHICS AND DOCTOR-PATIENT RELATIONSHIP - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOETHICS, FORENSIC MEDICINE], PLASTIC, VASCULAR AND ROBOTIC SURGERY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL ROBOTICS, PLASTIC SURGERY, VASCULAR SURGERY], EVALUATED PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE FOR STATE EXAMINATION (TPVES), CLINICAL MANAGEMENT OF PATUENTS [INTERNAL MEDICINE, GENERAL SURGERY] and HEART SURGERY, EMERGENCIES AND LIFE SUPPORT TECHNIQUES - INTEGRATED COURSE [EMERGENCY MEDICINE, HEART SURGERY, ANAESTHESIOLOGY, INTENSIVE CARE AND PALLIATIVE CARE].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in cultural heritage: knowledge, management, enhancement curriculum cultural heritage and tourism?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in cultural heritage: knowledge, management, enhancement curriculum cultural heritage and tourism are: GREEK HISTORY, ROMAN HISTORY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, ITALIAN LINGUISTICS AND DIALECTOLOGY [ITALIAN LINGUISTICS AND COMMUNICATION, ITALIAN DIALECTOLOGY], CULTURE AND TEXTS OF THE MIDDLE AGE and ARCHAEOLOGY OF ANCIENT SICILY [ARCHAEOLOGICAL ITINERARIES, INTRODUCTION TO THE ARCHAEOLOGY OF GREEK-ROMAN SICILY]. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in cultural heritage: knowledge, management, enhancement curriculum cultural heritage and tourism?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in cultural heritage: knowledge, management, enhancement curriculum cultural heritage and tourism are: STUDIO I, MEDIEVAL HISTORY/EARLY MODERN HISTORY [MEDIEVAL HISTORY, MODERN HISTORY], HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN ART [HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL ART, HISTORY OF MODERN ART] and ANCIENT ROME LITERARY CIVILISATION. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: MEDIEVAL LATIN LITERATURE, HISTORY AND TEXTS OF LATIN LITERATURE. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: CHRISTIAN AND MEDIEVAL ARCHAEOLOGY, MUSEOLOGY, ANCIENT TOPOGRAPHY [CARTOGRAPHY AND AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY], CARTOGRAPHY AND AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY [LANDSCAPE TOPOGRAPHY AND ARCHAEOLOGY], LANDSCAPE TOPOGRAPHY AND ARCHAEOLOGY, INTANGIBLE HERITAGE, ANCIENT AND MEDIEVAL NUMISMATICS, ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORY OF GREEK ART.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in cultural heritage: knowledge, management, enhancement curriculum cultural heritage and tourism?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in cultural heritage: knowledge, management, enhancement curriculum cultural heritage and tourism are: LABORATORY II, CULTURAL HERITAGE REGULATIONS, INTERNSHIP, DIGITAL COMMUNICATION WORKSHOP, ITALIAN LITERATURE (CULTURAL ITINERARIES AND LITERARY PARKS), APPLIED ECONOMICS FOR CULTURAL HERITAGE and LABORATORY III. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: PHOENICIAN AND PUNIC ARCHAEOLOGY, PRE-HISTORY AND PROTO-HISTORY, ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORY OF ART OF ANCIENT NEAR EAST, HISTORIC GEOGRAPHY OF THE GREEK WORLD, HISTORY METHODOLOGY AND TEACHING, ARCHAEOLOGICAL METHODOLOGY.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in conservation and restoration of cultural heritage curriculum painted wooden and textile artefacts; wooden carved artefacts; wooden furniture and structures; processed, assembled and/or painted synthetic materials artefacts?

answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in conservation and restoration of cultural heritage curriculum painted wooden and textile artefacts; wooden carved artefacts; wooden furniture and structures; processed, assembled and/or painted synthetic materials artefacts are: GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, PHYSICS, LABORATORY 1 - PAINTED ARTEFACTS ON WOOD AND TEXTILES, ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, RESTORATION THEORY. HISTORY AND DESIGN [THEORY. HISTORY AND DESIGN OF REAL ESTATE RESTORATION, THEORY. HISTORY AND DESIGN OF MOVABLE ASSETS RESTORATION], GRAPHIC DESIGN AND DOCUMENTATION, ELEMENTS OF ARCHIVAL AND LIBRARY HERITAGE CONSERVATION and ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in biological sciences?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in biological sciences are: MATHEMATICS WITH PRACTICE, CYTOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY WITH PRACTICE, GENERAL CHEMISTRY WITH PRACTICE, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, GENERAL AND SYSTEMATIC BOTANY WITH PRACTICE [GENERAL BOTANY WITH PRACTICE, SYSTEMATIC BOTANY WITH PRACTICE], ORGANIC CHEMISTRY WITH PRACTICE, PHYSICS AND CHEMICAL PHYSICS WITH PRACTICE [PHYSICS WITH PRACTICE, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY] and ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in biological sciences?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in biological sciences are: BIOCHEMISTRY WITH PRACTICE, GENETICS WITH PRACTICE, GENERAL AND SYSTEMATIC ZOOLOGY WITH PRACTICE [ZOOLOGY II WITH PRACTICE, ZOOLOGY I WITH PRACTICE], MOLECULAR BIOLOGY WITH PRACTICE, PLANT PHYSIOLOGY WITH PRACTICE, COMPARATIVE ANATOMY and COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in biological sciences?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in biological sciences are: BIOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT, GENERAL PHYSIOLOGY, MICROBIOLOGY WITH PRACTICE, GENERAL AND APPLIED ECOLOGY WITH PRACTICE [GENERAL ECOLOGY, ECOLOGY APPLICATIONS WITH PRACTICE], EXPERIMENTAL BIOLOGY LABORATORY and PRACTICE. free subjects is also included. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation?
context: 471_LAW (TRAPANI) - FORENSIC CURRICULUM WITH CIVILISTIC AND BUSINESS ORIENTATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation are: CONSTITUTIONAL LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [CONSTITUTIONAL LAW - MODULE I, CONSTITUTIONAL LAW - MODULE II], POLITICAL ECONOMICS, ELEMENTS OF PRIVATE LAW, HISTORY OF ROMAN LAW, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A I, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A II, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A III, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A IV, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A V, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A VI, INFORMATION LITERACY and LEGAL PHILOSOPHY. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation?
context: 471_LAW (TRAPANI) - FORENSIC CURRICULUM WITH CIVILISTIC AND BUSINESS ORIENTATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation are: COMMERCIAL LAW I, LABOUR LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [LABOUR LAW - MODULE II, LABOUR LAW - MODULE I] and ITALIAN AND COMPARATIVE ECCLESIASTICAL LAW. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: COMPARATIVE PUBLIC LAW, COMPARATIVE PRIVATE LAW. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: LAND LAW, ECONOMIC LAW.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation?
context: 471_LAW (TRAPANI) - FORENSIC CURRICULUM WITH CIVILISTIC AND BUSINESS ORIENTATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the third year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation are: CIVIL LAW I, CRIMINAL LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [CRIMINAL LAW (I MODULE), CRIMINAL LAW (II MODULE)], HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN LAW - MODULE II, HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN LAW - MODULE I], INTERNATIONAL LAW, EUROPEAN UNION LAW and ROMAN LAW.

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation?
context: 471_LAW (TRAPANI) - FORENSIC CURRICULUM WITH CIVILISTIC AND BUSINESS ORIENTATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation are: ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, COMMERCIAL LAW II, CRIMINAL PROCEDURAL  LAW - - INTEGRATED COURSE [CRIMINAL PROCEDURAL LAW - MODULE I, CRIMINAL PROCEDURAL LAW - MODULE II], CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW AND ELEMENTS OF LEGAL COMPUTER SCIENCE - INTEGRATED COURSE [CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW  WITH ELEMENTS OF LEGAL INFORMATICS - MODULE II, CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW  WITH ELEMENTS OF LEGAL INFORMATICS - MODULE I], NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B I, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B II, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B III, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B IV, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B V, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B VI, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE and TAXATION LAW. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: LEGAL LOGIC AND METHODOLOGY, DEONTOLOGY, SOCIOLOGY AND LAW CRITICISM.

question: What are the subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation?
context: 471_LAW (TRAPANI) - FORENSIC CURRICULUM WITH CIVILISTIC AND BUSINESS ORIENTATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (trapani) - forensic curriculum with civilistic and business orientation are: TAX JUSTICE, CIVIL LAW II and PROCEDURAL ADMINISTRATIVE LAW. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: FAMILY LAW, CIVIL RIGHTS PROTECTION, CIVIL LAW AND GENDER IDENTITY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VI: BANKING LAW, INDUSTRIAL LAW, BUSINESS CRISIS LAW. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VII: SOCIAL SECURITY LAW, GENDER EQUALITY AND LABOUR LAW, PRIVATE AUTONOMY AND LABOUR CONTRACTS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: DEVELOPMENT ECONOMICS, COMPARATIVE AND EUROPEAN PRIVATE LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [COMPARATIVE PRIVATE LAW], COMPARATIVE PRIVATE LAW [EUROPEAN PRIVATE LAW], EUROPEAN PRIVATE LAW, MARITIME LAW, CANON MATRIMONIAL LAW, COMPANY TAXATION LAW, EUROPEAN CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW, ROMAN JURISPRUDENCE, LAW TEACHING METHODOLOGY, JUDICIAL SYSTEM - INTEGRATED COURSE [JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 2], JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 2 [JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 1], JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 1, HISTORY OF WOMEN'S RIGHTS, INTERNET AND DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES LAW.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in natural and environmental sciences?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in natural and environmental sciences are: PHYSICS, MATHEMATICS, PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, INFORMATION LITERACY, ELEMENTS OF CHEMISTRY, CELL BIOLOGY and BOTANY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL BOTANY, SYSTEMATIC BOTANY].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in natural and environmental sciences?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in natural and environmental sciences are: ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, MINERALOGY, PETROGRAPHY, ZOOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ZOOLOGY 2, ZOOLOGY 1], ECOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [EXPERIMENTAL ECOLOGY, GENERAL ECOLOGY], GENETICS AND MICROBIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENETICS, MICROBIOLOGY] and GEOLOGY AND GEOCHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GEOCHEMISTRY, GEOLOGY].

answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in natural and environmental sciences are: ANTHROPOLOGY, MARINE BIOLOGY, EDUCATIONAL TRIPS, GEOMORPHOLOGY, ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, INTERNSHIP AND PRACTICE, ENVIRONMENTAL BIOMONITORING and ENVIRONMENTAL GEOCHEMISTRY AND BIOCHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ENVIRONMENTAL GEOCHEMISTRY, ENVIRONMENTAL BIOCHEMISTRY]. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ETHOLOGY, LANDSCAPE ECOLOGY, COMPARATIVE ANATOMY, NATURAL SUBSTANCES, AEROBIOLOGY, ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY AND INNOVATION - INTEGRATED COURSE [ENVIRONMENT INNOVATION], ENVIRONMENT INNOVATION [ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY], ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY, ANIMAL PHYSIOLOGY. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in gastronomic science curriculum gastronomic sciences?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in gastronomic science curriculum gastronomic sciences are: ELEMENTS OF GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE (in english), ZOOTECHNICS AND GENETIC TRACEABILITY OF ANIMAL PRODUCTIONS, PLANTS IN GASTRONOMY, PPRINCIPLES OF STATISTICS FOR FOOD SCIENCES, FOOD AND WINE ECONOMICS, HERBACEOUS CROPS CULTUVATION METHODS AND QUALITY and QUALITATIVE TRAITS OF TREE FRUITS. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ANTHROPOLOGY OF ALIMENTATION.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in gastronomic science curriculum gastronomic sciences?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in gastronomic science curriculum gastronomic sciences are: INTERNSHIP, BIOCHEMISTRY AND FOOD CHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOCHEMISTRY OF NUTRITION, FOOD COMPOSITION], HORTICULTURAL PRODUCTS AND MUSHROOMS IN GASTRONOMY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MUSHROOMS IN GASTRONOMY, QUALITY HORTICULTURAL PRODUCTS], FOOD MICROBIOLOGY, PHYSIOLOGY AND INTERNAL MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY AND PHYSIOLOGY OF  NUTRITION, INTERNAL MEDICINE APPLIED TO HUMAN SCIENCES] and SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY OF FOOD AND WINE PRODUCTS. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: FOOD AND RELIGIONS, AROMATIC AND MEDICINAL PLANTS IN GASTRONOMY, FOOD AND WINE DEVEL.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in gastronomic science curriculum gastronomic sciences?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in gastronomic science curriculum gastronomic sciences are: ALIMENTATION AND HEALTH, HISTORY AND GEOGRAPHY OF FOOD - INTEGRATED COURSE [HISTORY OF FOOD CULTURE, CULTURAL GEOGRAPHY OF FOOD], SENSORY ANALYSIS OF FOOD AND BEVERAGE, FOOD CONSUMPTION SOCIOLOGY, QUALITY AND INSPECTION OF FOOD OF ANIMAL ORIGIN - INTEGRATED COURSE [FOOD HYGIENE AND INSPECTION, QUALITY OF ANIMAL PRODUCTS], FOOD SEMIOTICS and MARKETING AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE - INTEGRATED COURSE [FOOD AND WINE PRODUCTS MARKETING, BUSINESS STRATEGY AND POLICY]. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in nursing curriculum nursing (qualifying for the professional practice) - caltanissetta?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in nursing curriculum nursing (qualifying for the professional practice) - caltanissetta are: GENERAL NURSING - INTEGRATED COURSE [THEORY OF NURSING CARE, GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY, HEALTH RECORDS COMPUTERIZATION], APPLIED BIOLOGY AND GENETICS, HUMAN ANATOMY WITH ELEMENTS OF HISTOLOGY, FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH), MICROBIOLOGY AND GENERAL PATHOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL PATHOLOGY, MICROBIOLOGY], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR, CLINICAL NURSING METHODOLOGY and HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in nursing curriculum nursing (qualifying for the professional practice) - caltanissetta?

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in nursing curriculum nursing (qualifying for the professional practice) - caltanissetta?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in biodiveristy and technological innovation curriculum biodiversity and technological innovation?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in biodiveristy and technological innovation curriculum biodiversity and technological innovation are: PLANT BIOLOGY -- INTEGRATED COURSE [PLANT BIODIVERSITY, PLANT BIOLOGY], ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, PHYSICS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING, MATHEMATICS FOR EXPERIMENTAL RESEARCH WITH ELEMENTS OF STATISTICS, ANIMAL BIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANIMAL BIOLOGY, ANIMAL BIODIVERSITY], OCEANOGRAPHY, ENVIRONMENTAL CHEMISTRY and PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHY AND GIS LABORATORY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in biodiveristy and technological innovation curriculum biodiversity and technological innovation?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in biodiveristy and technological innovation curriculum biodiversity and technological innovation are: ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, ECOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL ECOLOGY, ECOLOGY APPLICATIONS], BIO-GEOCHEMICAL CYCLES - INTEGRATED COURSE [GEOMICROBIOLOGY, GEOCHEMISTRY], MARINE GEOLOGY, ENVIRONMENTAL LAW AND APPLIED ECONOMICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ENVIRONMENT LAW, ECONOMICS APPLIED TO ECOSYSTEMS], GENETIC VARIABILITY OF BIODIVERSITY AND MOLECULAR BIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MOLECULAR BIOLOGY, GENETIC VARIABILITY] and BIODIVERSITY AND FUNCTIONS AND ADAPTATIONS OF STRUCTURES.

answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in biodiveristy and technological innovation curriculum biodiversity and technological innovation are: PRACTICE, SEMINARS AND EDUCATIONAL TRIPS, HEALTH ISSUES MANAGEMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENT, NEW GREEN DEAL], CLIMATE CHANGE AND BIODIVERSITY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ECOLOGICAL EFFECTS, EFFECTS UPON ORGANISMS, HYDROLOGY AND CLIMATE CHANGE], REMOTE SENSING FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING, AQUATIC PRODUCTION and ELEMENTS OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE FOR BIODIVERSITY MONITORING. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: BIODIVERSITY CONSERVATION, GEOLOGICAL PROCESSES, APPLIED ZOOLOGY, BIODIVERSITY FOR ALIMENTATION, SENSOR TECHNOLOGY AND SOFTWARE APPLICATIONS FOR BIODIVERSITY MANAGEMENT. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - forensic  curriculum - criminal law?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-68)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-68) are: SPORTS MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [SPORTS MEDICINE, ARTICULAR PHYSIOLOGY AND FUNCTIONAL ANALYSIS OF MOVEMENT], TRAINING METHODOLOGY AND PLANNING IN FITNESS SPORTS - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED HUMAN ANATOMY FOR SPORT PERFORMANCE, TRAINING METHODOLOGY AND PLANNING FOR FITNESS ACTIVITIES], METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF FUNCTIONAL EVALUATION IN HIGH LEVEL ATHLETES - INTEGRATED COURSE [METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF FUNCTIONAL EVALUATION AND RESEARCH IN PHYSICAL EDUCATION, METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF FUNCTIONAL EVALUATION AND RESEARCH IN SPORTS], OTHER LANGUAGE SKILLS: ENGLISH, ADAPTABILITY AND ADAPTATIONS IN SPORT TRAINING - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED BIOCHEMISTRY FOR SPORTS, PHYSIOLOGY APPLIED TO SPORT], PHYSICAL EXERCISE PLANNING IN DISABILITIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [SCIENCE AND TECHNIQUE OF ADAPTED MOTORIAL AND SPORT ACTIVITY, LOCOMOTOR SYSTEM DISEASES AND RELATED IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS] and APPLIED DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATIONAL PSYCHOLOGY FOR PHYSICAL EXERCISE.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-68)?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-68) are: INTERNSHIP, SOCIOLOGY AND PSYCHOLOGY OF CULTURAL AND COMMUNICATION PROCESSES [SOCIOLOGY OF CULTURAL AND COMMUNICATION PROCESSES IN SPORT, PSYCHOLOGY OF COMMUNICATION PROCESSES IN SPORT], INDIVISUAL SPORTS METHODS AND PLANNING IN SCHOOL - INTEGRATED COURSE [THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF AQUATIC SPORTS IN SCHOOL AND EXTRA-SCHOOL ENVIRONMENTS, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF ATHLETICS IN SCHOOL], ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET and FOR. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: FOOD INTEGRATION, DRUGS AND DOPING IN SPORTS, INTEGRATED PREVENTIVE METHODS IN POSTUROLOGY, AUDIOVESTIBOLOGY: CORRELATIONS WITH MOTORIAL AND SPORT ACTIVITIES, FIRST AID DURING SPORT ACTIVITIES, PHYSICAL AND SPORT ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT SCHOOL INCLUSION, RELATIONAL DYNAMIC PSYCHOLOGY, RETURN TO SPORTS AND ACCIDENT PREVENTION IN SPORT, PRINCIPLES OF PUBLIC LAW AND SCHOOL REGULATIONS, PHYSICAL AND REHABILITATIVE MEDICINE, NUTRITION IN SPORT AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum public communication?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum public communication are: ANALYSIS OF PUBLIC TEXTS, HISTORY OF POLITICAL THOUGHT AND PUBLIC OPINION, CULTURAL HISTORY OF THE MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY AGE, PUBLIC LAW, COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2 and PUBLIC CONSULTATION AND PARTICIPATORY PROCESSES. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: WRITING - WORKSHOP [CREATIVE WRITING], CREATIVE WRITING [TEXT AND COMMUNICATION], TEXT AND COMMUNICATION, JOURNALISM WORKSHOP, COMPUTER TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE WEB - WORKSHOP, VISUAL DESIGN STUDIO, QUALITATIVE SOCIOLOGY WORKSHOP [METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW], METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW [QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES], QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES, SCREENWRITING WORKSHOP, LINGUISTICS WORKSHOP [LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE], LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE [COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE], COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE, PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP, POLITICAL COMMUNICATION WORKSHOP.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum public communication?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum public communication are: BUSINESS ORGANISATION, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION SOCIOLOGY, ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, THEORY AND TECHNIQUES OF PUBLIC COMMUNICATION and POLITICAL PHILOSOPHY. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: SOCIAL STATISTICS, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PHILOSOPHY, CULTURAL GEOGRAPHY, GENDER STUDIES, SOCIOLOGY OF DEVIANCE, HISTORY  OF CINEMA AND CINEMA STUDIES, PUBLIC POLICIES.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in civil engineering curriculum hydraulics?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in civil engineering curriculum hydraulics are: AQUEDUCTS AND SEWERAGES, TOWN PLANNING, VIBRATIONS (in english), ROAD, RAILROAD AND AIRPORT TECHNIQUE, DESIGN OF STEEL AND CONCRETE STRUCTURES (in english), SANITARY AND ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING (in english) and ADVANCED GEOMECHANICS (in english). free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: BIM FOR STRUCTURES AND INFRASTRUCTURES, PRINCIPLES OF APPLIED CIRCULAR ECONOMICS FOR CIVIL BUILDING ENGINEERING.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in civil engineering curriculum hydraulics?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in civil engineering curriculum hydraulics are: MARITIME CONSTRUCTIONS, PLANT ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND HYDROELECTRIC PRODUCTION - INTEGRATED COURSE [HYDRODYNAMICS OF NETWORKS AND NATURAL BASINS, HYDROELECTRIC PRODUCTION AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY OF HYDRAULIC SYSTEMS], WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT and HYDRAULIC PROTECTION OF LAND. stage/intership and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: RENEWABLE SOURCES POWER PRODUCTION.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in mathematics?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in mathematics are: HISTORY OF MATHEMATICS, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2, SUPERIOR ANALYSIS, SUPERIOR ALGEBRA and DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS IN MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: NUMERICAL ANALYSIS [NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1 [NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2, UNCERTAIN REASONING AND PROBABILITY, MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS, MATHEMATICAL METHODS AND MODELS FOR APPLICATIONS.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in mathematics?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in mathematics are: ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET and TOPOLOGICAL GROUPS AND LIE GROUPS. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: NON LINEAR ANALYSIS, THEORY OF CODES AND CRYPTOGRAPHY, REPRESENTATION THEORY, MATHEMATICS DIDACTICS AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY, COMPLEMENTS OF MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS, ALGEBRAIC GEOMETRY, NON-COMMUTATIVE ALGEBRA. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: NUMERICAL ANALYSIS [NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2 [NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1, UNCERTAIN REASONING AND PROBABILITY, MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS, MATHEMATICAL METHODS AND MODELS FOR APPLICATIONS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: NUMERICAL ANALYSIS [NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2 [NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1, UNCERTAIN REASONING AND PROBABILITY, MATHEMATICAL PHYSICS, PHYSICS - LABORATORY, MATHEMATICAL METHODS AND MODELS FOR APPLICATIONS, THEORIES AND TECHNIQUES OF IMAGE ANALYSIS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in animal pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals curriculum animal pharmaceutics and nutraceutics?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in animal pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals curriculum animal pharmaceutics and nutraceutics are: PHYSICS WITH ELEMENTS OF MATHEMATICS, BOTANY FOR VETERINARY SCIENCE AND PHARMACOGNOSIS - INTEGRATED COURSE [VETERINARY BOTANY, PHARMACOGNOSIS], ANIMAL BIOLOGY AND ZOOLOGY [ANIMAL BIOLOGY, ZOOLOGY], GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, SAFETY IN LABORATORIES AND IN THE WORKPLACE, COMPUTING SKILLS, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, APPLIED MICROBIOLOGY FOR PRODUCTS FOR ANIMALS and PHYSIOLOGY OF ANIMAL NUTRITION AND ANIMAL FEED.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in animal pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals curriculum animal pharmaceutics and nutraceutics?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in animal pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals curriculum animal pharmaceutics and nutraceutics are: ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, VETERINARY DRUG ANALYSIS, ANIMAL NUTRACEUTICS AND FOOD CHEMISTRY FOR ANIMALS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANIMAL FOOD CHEMISTRY, ANIMAL NUTRACEUTICS], VETERINARY BIOCHEMISTRY, DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT OF NUTRACEUTICALS, COMPLEMENTARY FEED AND MEDICAL FEED and INFECTIOUS DISEASES AND ANIMAL WELLBEING. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ELEMENTS OF ANIMAN HUSBANDRY, NEW CHEMICAL-PHARMACEUTICAL APPROACH AGAINST ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in animal pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals curriculum animal pharmaceutics and nutraceutics?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in animal pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals curriculum animal pharmaceutics and nutraceutics are: REGULATIONS ON FOOD, HEALTH PRODUCTS AND VETERINARY DRUGS, VETERINARY PHARMACEUTICAL CHEMISTRY, DOSAGE FORMS TECHNOLOGIES OF VETERINARY DRUGS AND NUTRACEUTICALS, PHARMACOLOGICAL BASES IN VETERINARY SCIENCE, PRACTICE, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET and INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTION AND QUALITY CONTROL OF VETERINARY DRUGS AND NUTRACEUTICAL PRODUCTS. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: VETERINARY MEDICAL DEVICES AND REGULATIONS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in nursing curriculum nursing (qualifying for the professional practice) - palermo?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in nursing curriculum nursing (qualifying for the professional practice) - palermo are: GENERAL NURSING - INTEGRATED COURSE [THEORY OF NURSING CARE, GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY, HEALTH RECORDS COMPUTERIZATION], APPLIED BIOLOGY AND GENETICS, HUMAN ANATOMY WITH ELEMENTS OF HISTOLOGY, FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH), MICROBIOLOGY AND GENERAL PATHOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL PATHOLOGY, MICROBIOLOGY], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR, CLINICAL NURSING METHODOLOGY and HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in classic studies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in classic studies are: LATIN LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE (SEMINAR), GREEK HISTORY AND HISTORIOGRAPHY (SEMINAR), GREEK LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE  (SEMINAR) and DIGITAL HUMANITIES WORKSHOP. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: LATIN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, GREEK EPIGRAPHY, HISTORY OF ROMAN THEATRE [TRAGIC THEATRE], TRAGIC THEATRE [COMIC THEATRE], COMIC THEATRE, LATIN RHETORIC, HISTORY OF GREEK SICILY, TEACHING METHODOLOGY AND HISTORY OF GREEK LANGUAGE, MUSIC, POETRY AND DRAMA IN ANCIENT GREECE.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in classic studies?

It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: MEDIEVAL AND MODERN GREEK PHILOLOGY, HISTORY OF JUDAIC THOUGHT, GREEK LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, LATIN TEACHING METHODOLOGY, ANCIENT INDIA CIVILISATION [ANCIENT INDIA CIVILISATION: PHILISOPHY AND RELIGIONS OF INDIA], ANCIENT INDIA CIVILISATION: PHILISOPHY AND RELIGIONS OF INDIA [ANCIENT INDIA CIVILISATION: TEXTS], ANCIENT INDIA CIVILISATION: TEXTS. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-67)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-67) are: SPORTS MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [SPORTS MEDICINE, ARTICULAR PHYSIOLOGY AND FUNCTIONAL ANALYSIS OF MOVEMENT], TRAINING METHODOLOGY AND PLANNING IN FITNESS SPORTS - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED HUMAN ANATOMY FOR SPORT PERFORMANCE, TRAINING METHODOLOGY AND PLANNING FOR FITNESS ACTIVITIES], METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF FUNCTIONAL EVALUATION IN HIGH LEVEL ATHLETES - INTEGRATED COURSE [METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF FUNCTIONAL EVALUATION AND RESEARCH IN PHYSICAL EDUCATION, METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF FUNCTIONAL EVALUATION AND RESEARCH IN SPORTS], OTHER LANGUAGE SKILLS: ENGLISH, ADAPTABILITY AND ADAPTATIONS IN SPORT TRAINING - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED BIOCHEMISTRY FOR SPORTS, PHYSIOLOGY APPLIED TO SPORT], PHYSICAL EXERCISE PLANNING IN DISABILITIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [LOCOMOTOR SYSTEM DISEASES AND RELATED IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, SCIENCE AND TECHNIQUE OF ADAPTED MOTORIAL AND SPORT ACTIVITY] and APPLIED DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATIONAL PSYCHOLOGY FOR PHYSICAL EXERCISE.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-67)?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in science of preventive and adapted physical activity and sport performance curriculum sciences and techniques of sport performance (lm-67) are: INTERNSHIP, SOCIOLOGY AND PSYCHOLOGY OF CULTURAL AND COMMUNICATION PROCESSES [PSYCHOLOGY OF COMMUNICATION PROCESSES IN SPORT, SOCIOLOGY OF CULTURAL AND COMMUNICATION PROCESSES IN SPORT], INDIVISUAL SPORTS METHODS AND PLANNING IN SCHOOL - INTEGRATED COURSE [THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF ATHLETICS IN SCHOOL, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF AQUATIC SPORTS IN SCHOOL AND EXTRA-SCHOOL ENVIRONMENTS], ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET and FOR. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: FOOD INTEGRATION, DRUGS AND DOPING IN SPORTS, INTEGRATED PREVENTIVE METHODS IN POSTUROLOGY, AUDIOVESTIBOLOGY: CORRELATIONS WITH MOTORIAL AND SPORT ACTIVITIES, FIRST AID DURING SPORT ACTIVITIES, PHYSICAL AND SPORT ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT SCHOOL INCLUSION, RELATIONAL DYNAMIC PSYCHOLOGY, RETURN TO SPORTS AND ACCIDENT PREVENTION IN SPORT, PRINCIPLES OF PUBLIC LAW AND SCHOOL REGULATIONS, PHYSICAL AND REHABILITATIVE MEDICINE, NUTRITION IN SPORT AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in biodiversity and environmental biology curriculum biodiveristy and environmental biology?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in biodiversity and environmental biology curriculum biodiveristy and environmental biology are: EVOLUTIONARY ZOOLOGY [ANIMAL SYSTEMATICS AND PHILOGENESIS, ETHOLOGY AND EVOLUTION OF ANIMAL BEHAVIOUR], BIODIVERSITY AND APPLICATIONS [ANIMAL BIODIVERSITY AND MOLECULAR ANALYSIS, PLANT BIODIVERSITY AND HEALTH], BIOLOGICAL ANALYSIS OF AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANALYSIS OF AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS, STRESS RESPONSES IN AQUATIC ORGANISMS], PLANT MONITORING AND CONSERVATION [EX SITU AND IN SITU CONSERVATION METHODS, ENVIRONMENTAL BIO-MONITORING METHODS], ADAPTIVE STRATEGIES OF PLANTS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ECO-PHYSIOLOGY OF STRESS, EVOLUTION AND ADAPTATION] and GENETICS AND GENOMICS APPLICATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [MOLECULAR AND GMO APPLICATIONS WITH PRACTICE, GENETICS APPLICATIONS WITH PRACTICE].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in biodiversity and environmental biology curriculum biodiveristy and environmental biology?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in biodiversity and environmental biology curriculum biodiveristy and environmental biology are: INTERNSHIP AND PRACTICE, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2, PALEO-DIVERSITY AND PALEO-ENVIRONMENTS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANTHROPOLOGY AND HUMAN EVOLUTION, CLIMATE VARIATIONS AND BIODIVERSITY], FAUNAL INDICATORS AND ENVIRONMENTAL EVALUATION, ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS AND SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT, PRACTICE and VERTEBRATE ZOOLOGY. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: STUDY TECHNIQUES AND APPLICATIONS OF PLANT RESOURCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED PHYCOLOGY WITH PRACTICE], APPLIED PHYCOLOGY WITH PRACTICE [MORPHO-METRIC AND CYTO-HISTOLOGIC TECHNIQUES], MORPHO-METRIC AND CYTO-HISTOLOGIC TECHNIQUES [PLANT EXTRACTS AND BIO-CONTROL], PLANT EXTRACTS AND BIO-CONTROL, CLIMATE CHANGES IMPACT UPON PLANT BIODIVERSITY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ALGAE], ALGAE [LICHEN], LICHEN [LAND PLANTS], LAND PLANTS, SICILIAN OFFICINAL FLORA, ENVIRONMENTAL AND CLIMATE RECONSTRUCTION THROUGH MICROORGANISMS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in psychiatric rehabilitation technique?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in psychiatric rehabilitation technique are: PHYSICS AND BIOCHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CHEMISTRY AND BIOCHEMISTRY PROPAEDEUTICS, APPLIED MEDICAL PHYSICS], PSYCHIATRIC REHABILITATION AND MEDICAL STATISTICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL STATISTICS, ELEMENTS AND TENETS OF PSYCHIATRIC REHABILITATION], APPLIED BIOLOGY AND HUMAN ANATOMY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN ANATOMY, APPLIED BIOLOGY AND GENETICS], FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH), PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR, PHYSIOLOGY and PSYCHIATRY, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY AND NEUROLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PSYCHIATRY I, NEUROLOGY, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY I].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in psychiatric rehabilitation technique?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in psychiatric rehabilitation technique are: SCIENCE OF PREVENTION AND FORENSIC MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY, HYGIENE, FORENSIC MEDICINE], CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY AND BUSINESS ORGANISATION - INTEGRATED COURSE [BUSINESS ORGANISATION, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY II], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  II YEAR, SCIENCES OF THE DEVELOPMENTAL AGE - INTEGRATED COURSE [PSYCHOPATHOLOGY OF ADOLESCENCE, PAEDIATRICS] and PHARMACOLOGICAL-REHABILITATIVE INTEGRATED APPROACHES TO PSYCHIATRIC TROUBLES - INTEGRATED COURSE [THEORIES AND MODELS OF PSYCHIATRIC REHABILITATION, PSYCHIATRY II, PSYCHOPHARMACOLOGY].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in psychiatric rehabilitation technique?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in psychiatric rehabilitation technique are: INTERDISCIPLINARY SCIENCES  - INTEGRATED COURSE [METHODOLOGY AND DESIGN OF INTERVENTIONS IN PSYCHIATRIC REHABILITATION, INTERNAL MEDICINE, PHYSICAL AND REHABILITATIVE MEDICINE], REHABILITATION TECHNIQUES AND ART THERAPIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [CINEMA, PHOTOGRAPHY AND TELEVISION, THERAPEUTIC AND REHABILITATIVE TECHNIQUES], OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  III YEAR, SPECIALIST PROFESSIONAL WORKSHOP and SCIENCE OF DEVELOPMENTAL AGE II - INTEGRATED COURSE [PSYCHIATRIC REHABILITATION IN CHILDHOOD AND ADOLESCENCE, ADDICTIONS AND BEHAVIOURAL DISORDERS IN ADOLESCENCE, CHILD NEUROPSYCHIATRY, ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in mediterranean agricultural systems?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in mediterranean agricultural systems are: ENGLISH LANGUAGE, ELEMENTS OF GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, ELEMENTS OF AGRICULTURAL GENETICS AND GENETIC IMPROVEMENT, ELEMENTS OF MAHEMATICS AND PHYSICS, APPLIED BOTANY AND ELEMENTS OF PLANT PHYSIOLOGY, PHYTODEPURATION AND WASTE WATER USE IN AGRICULTURE, SOIL FERTILITY and AGRICULTURAL SYSTEMS ECONOMICS. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: CAD LABORATORY, HISTORY OF MEDITERRANEAN COUNTRIES POLITICAL INSTITUTIONS.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in mediterranean agricultural systems?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in mediterranean agricultural systems are: PRINCIPLES OF MECHANICS AND MECHANISATION IN AGRICULTURE, ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT OF OLIVE SUPPLY CHAIN - INTEGRATED COURSE [OLIVE OIL AND TABLE OLIVE TECHNOLOGY, PRINCIPLES OF OLIVE FARMING, GENERAL ARBORICULTURE], TROPICAL AND SUBTROPICAL FRUIT CHAINS IN THE MEDITERRANEAN ENVIRONMENT, HERBACEOUS CROPS FOR HOT ARID ENVIRONMENTS, HYDRAULIC DESIGN IN THE MEDITERRANEAN ENVIRONMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOIL DEFENCE AND CONSERVATION, IRRIGATION SYSTEMS DESIGN], AGRICULTURAL ECONOMICS AND VALUATION and GENERAL AGRONOMY AND DRY FARMING TECHNIQUES. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: CHARACTERISATION AND UPGRADING OF AGRICUTURAL PLANT BIODIVERSITY, QUALITI MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION OF FRUIT CROPS.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in mediterranean agricultural systems?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in mediterranean agricultural systems are: AGRICULTURAL ENTOMOLOGY, PLANT PATHOLOGY, INTERNSHIP, PRINCIPLES OF PLANT NURSERYY AND HORTI-FLOWER PRODUCTIO N, ZOOTECHNICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANIMAL PHYSIOLOGY AND ALIMENTATION, GENERAL ZOOTECHNICS AND ANIMAL BIODIVERSITY MANAGEMENT] and CERTIFICATIONS APPLIABLE TO THE PRIMARY SECTOR.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in chemistry?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in chemistry are: GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, MATHEMATICS I, CHEMICAL PREPARATIONS WITH LABORATORY PRACTICE, PHYSICS 1, MATHEMATICS II, SAFETY IN LABORATORIES AND IN THE WORKPLACE, BASIC COMPUTATIONAL METHODS FOR CHEMISTRY and ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: HISTORY OF CHEMISTRY.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in chemistry?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in chemistry are: BIOCHEMISTRY, APPLIED AND INSTRUMENTAL ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY [APPLIED ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, INSTRUMENTAL ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY], PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY II WITH LABORATORY [PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY II - LABORATORY, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY II], PRACTICE, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, PHYSICAL ORGANIC CHEMISTRY and PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY III WITH LABORATORY [PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY III, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY III - LABORATORY]. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: CHEMICAL KINETICS AND MOLECULAR DYNAMICS. answer: Subject of the second year of the bachelor degree in languages and literatures - intercultural studies curriculum language and literatures - intercultural studies (l-12) - agrigento is MUSEOLOGY. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: SPANISH LANGUAGE AND TRANSLATION II, ENGLISH LANGUAGE AND TRANSLATION II, FRENCH LANGUAGE AND TRANSLATION  II, ARAB LANGUAGE AND TRANSLATION II. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum publishing and cultural planning?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum publishing and cultural planning are: CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY, GENERAL LINGUISTICS, SEMIOTICS, SOCIOLOGY OF COMMUNICATION, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, CULTURAL STUDIES and ENGLISH LANGUAGE. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum publishing and cultural planning?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum publishing and cultural planning are: JOURNALISM AND LITERATURE, PHILOLOGY, HISTORY OF MUSIC, HISTORY  OF CINEMA AND CINEMA STUDIES and COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: WRITING - WORKSHOP [TEXT AND COMMUNICATION], TEXT AND COMMUNICATION [CREATIVE WRITING], CREATIVE WRITING, JOURNALISM WORKSHOP, COMPUTER TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE WEB - WORKSHOP, VISUAL DESIGN STUDIO, QUALITATIVE SOCIOLOGY WORKSHOP [QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES], QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES [METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW], METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW, SCREENWRITING WORKSHOP, LINGUISTICS WORKSHOP [COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE], COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE [LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE], LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE, PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP, POLITICAL COMMUNICATION WORKSHOP. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: ARAB LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION [MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE], MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE [MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION], MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION, GERMAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, ALBANIAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, ALBANIAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE, HEBRAIC LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, GERMAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE, ARAB LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE [MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE - ADVANCED COURSE], MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE - ADVANCED COURSE [MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE], MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum publishing and cultural planning?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum publishing and cultural planning are: HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PHILOSOPHY, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, TWENTIETH CENTURY LITERATURES and SOCIAL PHILOSOPHY. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: ARCHAEOLOGY, AESTHETICS, BUSINESS ORGANISATION, SOCIOLINGUISTICS, SOCIAL STATISTICS, CULTURAL GEOGRAPHY, THEORY OF TRANSLATION, GENDER STUDIES, CULTURAL HISTORY OF THE MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY AGE, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ART, PUBLIC POLICIES, IMAGE SEMIOTICS, TRANSLATION FOR PUBLISHERS, PUBLISHERS' RIGHTS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: ARAB LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION [MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE], MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE [MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION], MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION, GERMAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, ALBANIAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, ALBANIAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE, HEBRAIC LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION, GERMAN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE, ARAB LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE [MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE - ADVANCED COURSE], MODULE 1: ARAB LANGUAGE - ADVANCED COURSE [MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE], MODULE 2: ARAB CIVILISATION - ADVANCED COURSE.  A final examination is also scheduled.

INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN ANATOMY, ANATOMY OF THE STOMATOGNATIC SYSTEM], PREVENTIVE AND COMMUNITY DENTISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL STATISTICS, PREVENTIVE AND COMMUNITY DENTISTRY] and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: PREVENTIVE AND COMMUNITY DENTISTRY.

answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in dentistry are: MICROBIOLOGY AND GENERAL PATHOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MICROBIOLOGY AND CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY, GENERAL PATHOLOGY], HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY AND PHYSIOLOGY OF STOMATOGNATIC APPARATUS - INTEGRATED COURSE [STOMATOGNATIC APPARATUS PHYSIOLOGY, HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY], BIOCHEMISTRY AND CLINICAL MOLECULAR BIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY AND CLINICAL MOLECULAR BIOLOGY, BIOCHEMISTRY], GENERAL AND APPLIED HYGIENE, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: BASIC PRINCIPLES OF ODONTODTOMATOLOGY and PRINCIPLES OF ODONTOSTOMATOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY, INTRODUCTORY ODONTOSTOMATOLOGY, DENTAL HYGIENE].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the master degree in dentistry?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the master degree in dentistry are: LABORATORY DIAGNOSTICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL PATHOLOGY, PATHOLOGICAL ANATOMY], PHARMACOLOGY, DENTAL MATERIALS AND PROSTHETIC TECHNOLOGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [DENTAL MATERIALS, PROSTHETIC AND LABORATORY TECHNOLOGIES], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: DENTAL MATERIALS AND PROSTHETIC TECHNIQUES, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY, SPECIALIST ODONTOSTOMATOLOGICAL PATHOLOGY, MEDICAL SCIENCES  1 - INTEGRATED COURSE [ENDOCRINOLOGY, GASTROENTEROLOGY, INTERNAL MEDICINE], MEDICAL SCIENCES  2 - INTEGRATED COURSE [CUTANEOUS AND VENEREAL DISEASES, INFECTIOUS DISEASES, BLOOD DISEASES] and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: SPECIALIST ODONTOSTOMATOLOGICAL PATHOLOGY.

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in dentistry?
answer: Subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in dentistry are: SURGICAL SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL SURGERY, ANAESTHESIOLOGY AND EMERGENCY CARE], FORENSIC AND OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [FORENSIC MEDICINE, OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE], ORAL SURGERY I, NEUROLOGY AND PSYCHIATRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [NEUROLOGY, PSYCHIATRY], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE - ANAESTHESIA AND EMERGENCY CARE, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: ORAL SURGERY I, ORTHOGNATODONTICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [GNATOLOGY, ORTHODONTICS I, PERIODONTOLOGY   I], CARIOLOGY, CONSERVATIVE DENTISTRY AND ENDODONTICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [CONSERVATIVE DENTISTRY I, ENDODONTICS I], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: CARIOLOGY, CONSERVATIVE DENTISTRY AND ENDODONTICS and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE: ORTHOGNATODONTICS. question: What are the subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in dentistry?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in professional education (qualifying for professional practice) curriculum professional education?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in professional education (qualifying for professional practice) curriculum professional education are: COMPUTER SCIENCE, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I - SEMESTER I, PATHOLOGY, BIOCHEMISTRY AND ELEMENTS OF APPLIED BIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED BIOLOGY, CLINICAL PATHOLOGY, CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY AND CLINICAL MOLECULAR BIOLOGY], HUMAN ANATOMY AND PHYSIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PHYSIOLOGY, HISTOLOGY, ANATOMY], PSYCHOLOGY AND PEDAGOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY, PSYCHOPATHOLOGY OF REHABILITATION, PEDAGOGY OF HEALTH], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I - SEMESTER II and MENTAL HEALTH AND HEALTH EDUCATION - INTEGRATED COURSE [PSYCHIATRY, NEUROLOGY, PROFESSIONAL HEALTHCARE EDUCATION METHODOLOGY].

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum?
context: 2328_LAW (PALERMO) - PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND SUPRANATIONAL INSTITUTIONS CURRICULUM_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum are: CONSTITUTIONAL LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [CONSTITUTIONAL LAW - MODULE II, CONSTITUTIONAL LAW - MODULE I], POLITICAL ECONOMICS, ELEMENTS OF PRIVATE LAW, HISTORY OF ROMAN LAW, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A I, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A II, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A III, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A IV, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A V, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES A VI, INFORMATION LITERACY and LEGAL PHILOSOPHY. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum?
context: 2328_LAW (PALERMO) - PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND SUPRANATIONAL INSTITUTIONS CURRICULUM_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum are: COMMERCIAL LAW I, LABOUR LAW and ECCLESIASTICAL LAW. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: COMPARATIVE PRIVATE LAW, COMPARATIVE PUBLIC LAW. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: LAND LAW, ECONOMIC LAW.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum?
context: 2328_LAW (PALERMO) - PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND SUPRANATIONAL INSTITUTIONS CURRICULUM_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the third year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum are: CIVIL LAW I, EUROPEAN UNION LAW, CRIMINAL LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [CRIMINAL LAW (II MODULE), CRIMINAL LAW (I MODULE)], HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN LAW - MODULE I, HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL AND MODERN LAW - MODULE II], INTERNATIONAL LAW and ROMAN LAW.

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum?
context: 2328_LAW (PALERMO) - PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND SUPRANATIONAL INSTITUTIONS CURRICULUM_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum are: ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, CRIMINAL PROCEDURAL  LAW - - INTEGRATED COURSE [CRIMINAL PROCEDURAL LAW - MODULE I, CRIMINAL PROCEDURAL LAW - MODULE II], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW AND ELEMENTS OF LEGAL COMPUTER SCIENCE - INTEGRATED COURSE [CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW  WITH ELEMENTS OF LEGAL INFORMATICS - MODULE II, CIVIL PROCEDURAL LAW  WITH ELEMENTS OF LEGAL INFORMATICS - MODULE I], NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B I, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B II, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B III, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B IV, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B V, NON CURRICULAR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES B VI, COMMERCIAL LAW II and TAXATION LAW. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: LEGAL LOGIC AND METHODOLOGY, DEONTOLOGY, SOCIOLOGY AND LAW CRITICISM.

question: What are the subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum?
context: 2328_LAW (PALERMO) - PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND SUPRANATIONAL INSTITUTIONS CURRICULUM_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in law curriculum law (palermo) - public administration and supranational institutions curriculum are: CIVIL LAW II, TAX JUSTICE and PROCEDURAL ADMINISTRATIVE LAW. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: EUROPEAN ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, ENVIRONMENTAL LAW AND LAND GOVERNANCE, PUBLIC SECURITY ADMINISTRATIVE LAW. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VI: MIGRATION LAW, INTERNATIONAL HUMAN'S RIGHTS DEFENCE, INTERNATIONAL LAW AND USE OF FORCE. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VII: HUMAN RIGHTS, CONSTITUTIONAL JUSTICE, EUROPEAN CONSTITUTIONAL LAW. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: DEVELOPMENT ECONOMICS, ECONOMIC ANALYSIS OF LAW, HISTORY OF ROMAN CONSTITUTION, TAXATION SYSTEM OF LOCAL AND REGIONAL AGENCIES, JUDICIAL SYSTEM - INTEGRATED COURSE [JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 1], JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 1 [JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 2], JUDICIAL SYSTEM - MODULE 2, PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION LABOUR LAW, HISTORY OF ADMINISTRATIVE LAW AND PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION, LAW TEACHING METHODOLOGY, SOURCES OF PUBLIC LAW, HISTORY OF WOMEN'S RIGHTS, INTERNET AND DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES LAW, LEGAL CLINIC.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in nursing and midwifery?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in nursing and midwifery are: CLINICAL ASSISTANCE COMPLEXITY IN THE NURSING AND MIDWIFERY CONTEXT - INTEGRATED COURSE [CARE COMPLEXITY IN GYNAECOLOGY AND MIDWIFERY, CLINICAL APPROACH TO COMPLEX PATIENTS AND COMPLICATIONS, CLINICAL OBSTETRICS AND GYNAECOLOGY], EVIDENCE-BASED NURSING AND MIDWIFERY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL PATHOLOGY, NURSING AND MIDWIFERY RESEARCH METHODS, QUANTITATIVE METHODS FOR BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH], APPLIED  EPIDEMIOLOGICAL METHODOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HYGIENE AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE, PHARMACO-EPIDEMIOLOGY, CREATION AND MANAGEMENT OF SANITARY DATA BASES], SUSTAINABILITY OF HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS - INTEGRATED COURSE [BUSINESS ORGANISATION, BUSINESS ECONOMICS, SOCIAL PSYCHOLOGY], MEDICAL LEGAL ISSUES IN HEALTHCARE ORGANISATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [FORENSIC MEDICINE, ELEMENTS OF PUBLIC LAW, OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE] and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR - INTEGRATED COURSE [PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR - MED 47, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR - MED 45].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in nursing and midwifery?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in nursing and midwifery are: APPROACH TO TRANS-CULTURAL ISSUES - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOCIOLOGY OF CULTURAL  AND COMMUNICATION PROCESSES, TRANS-CULTURAL NURSING, CARE COMPLEXITY IN NURSING], CARE COMPLEXITY IN SPECIALIST AND EMERGENCY MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL CARE COMPLEXITY IN PAEDIATRICS, CLINICAL ASSISTANCE COMPLEXITY IN GENERAL AND EMERGENCY SURGERY, CLINICAL ASSISTANCE COMPLEXITY IN  NEUROLOGY], OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, HEALTH MANAGEMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN RESOURCES PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT, QUALITY AND RISK MANAGEMENT IN HEALTHCARE], ENGLISH LANGUAGE - FURTHER KNOWLEDGE and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  II  YEAR - INTEGRATED COURSE [PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  II  YEAR - MED 45, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  II  YEAR - MED 47, ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in electronics and telecommunications engineering (fully online) curriculum electronics and telecommunications engineering (lm-27)?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in viticulture and oenology curriculum viticulture and enology?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in viticulture and oenology curriculum viticulture and enology are: GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, MATHEMATICS, PLANT BIOLOGY AD GENETICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [AGRICULTURAL GENETICS, PLANT BIOLOGY], ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, PHYSICS, CHEMISTRY LABORATORY, EU FOREIGN LANGUAGE (in english), ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT OF VITICULTURAL COMPANIES and AGRONOMY AND SOIL MANAGEMENT [AGRONOMY, PRINCIPLES OF PAEDOLOGY].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in viticulture and oenology curriculum viticulture and enology?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in viticulture and oenology curriculum viticulture and enology are: GENERAL ARBORICULTURE, AGRICULTURAL BIOCHEMISTRY AND SOIL CHEMISTRY, BIOLOGICAL PROCESSES IN OENOLOGY, WINE GROWING, VITICULTURAL PATHOLOGY, OENOLOGICAL MICROBIOLOGY and WINE MARKETING AND WINE GROWING POLICY. stage/intership and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: CHEMICAL-PHYSICAL ANALYSIS OF AGRICULTURAL SOILS, BIOCHEMISTRY OF SECONDARY METABOLITES, STATISTICAL DATA ANALYSIS IN WINE GROWING AND OENOLOGY, ADVANCED LAND EVALUATION FOR VINEYARD SITE SELECTION (in english).

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in viticulture and oenology curriculum viticulture and enology?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in viticulture and oenology curriculum viticulture and enology are: PROFESSIONALISING SEMINAR, OENOLOGICAL PROCESSES AND SPECIAL VINIFICATIONS, QUALITY CONTROL IN THE WINE INDUSTRY [MICROBIOLOGICAL CONTROL, INSTRUMENTAL ANALYSIS], SENSORIAL ANALYSIS LABORATORY, VITICULTURAL ENTOMOLOGY AND ACAROLOGY, VINEYARD MANAGEMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [IRRIGATION PLANTS, WINE-GROWING TECHNIQUE] and WINE-GROWING MECHANISATION AND OENOLOGICAL PLANTS. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: WINE TOURISM, LABELING AND QUALITY CERTIFICATION, CELLAR ACCOUNTING AND RECORD KEEPING, TECHNOLOGY OF SWEET  AND LIQUEUR WINES, IRRIGATION SYSTEMS DESIGN, TABLE WINE GROWING AND VARIETY CHOICE.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum marketing and advertising?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum marketing and advertising are: CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY, GENERAL LINGUISTICS, SEMIOTICS, SOCIOLOGY OF COMMUNICATION, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, CULTURAL STUDIES and ENGLISH LANGUAGE. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum marketing and advertising?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum marketing and advertising are: AESTHETICS, MARKETING, HISTORY AND ANALYSIS OF ECONOMIC PHENOMENA, SEMIOTICS OF ADVERTISING, COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2 and THEORY AND TECHNIQUES OF ADVERTISING COMMUNICATION. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: WRITING - WORKSHOP [CREATIVE WRITING], CREATIVE WRITING [TEXT AND COMMUNICATION], TEXT AND COMMUNICATION, JOURNALISM WORKSHOP, COMPUTER TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE WEB - WORKSHOP, VISUAL DESIGN STUDIO, QUALITATIVE SOCIOLOGY WORKSHOP [METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW], METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW [QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES], QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES, SCREENWRITING WORKSHOP, LINGUISTICS WORKSHOP [COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE], COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE [LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE], LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE, PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP, POLITICAL COMMUNICATION WORKSHOP. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: BUSINESS ORGANISATION, SOCIOLINGUISTICS, SOCIAL STATISTICS, THEORY OF TRANSLATION, CULTURAL HISTORY OF THE MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY AGE, PRINCIIPLES OF VISUAL CULTURE, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ART, HISTORY OF MUSIC, IMAGE SEMIOTICS.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum marketing and advertising?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum marketing and advertising are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, COMMUNICATION LAW, CONSUMER PSYCHOLOGY, HISTORY  OF CINEMA AND CINEMA STUDIES and MUSIC FOR MOVIES AND ADVERTISING. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: BUSINESS ORGANISATION, SOCIOLINGUISTICS, SOCIAL STATISTICS, THEORY OF TRANSLATION, CULTURAL HISTORY OF THE MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY AGE, PRINCIIPLES OF VISUAL CULTURE, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ART, HISTORY OF MUSIC, IMAGE SEMIOTICS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in nursing?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in nursing are: BIOLOGY AND GENETICS (in english), HUMAN ANATOMY AND HISTOLOGY (in english), FOREIGN LANGUAGE (in english), GENERAL NURSING AND MEDICAL HUMANITIES - INTEGRAED COURSE (in english) [GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY (in english), BIOETHICS (in english), THEORY OF NURSING (in english)], GENERAL PATHOLOGY AND MICROBIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL PATHOLOGY (in english), MICROBIOLOGY], PHYSIOLOGY (in english), INTERNSHIP I (in english) and NURSING METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUES C.I. (in english) [NURSING METHODOLOGY, NURSING TECHNIQUES AND PROCEDURES].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in nursing?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in nursing are: PHARMACOLOGY, ONCOLOGY AND PALLIATIVE CARE - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [ONCOLOGY AND PALLIATIVE CARE (in english), PHARMACOLOGY (in english)], MEDICAL SCIENCE - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [INFECTIOUS DISEASES (in english), GASTROENTEROLOGY (in english), INTERNAL MEDICINE (in english)], DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY (in english), INTERNSHIP II (in english), NURSING METHODOLOGY IN ORTHOPAEDIC - REHABILITATIVE AREA C.I. (in english) [REHABILITATIVE NURSING (in english), ORTHOPEDIC NURSING], SURGICAL SCIENCE - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [UROLOGY (in english), GENERAL SURGERY (in english)] and RESEARCH METHODOLOGY, HYGIENE AND PREVENTION IN NURSING C.I. (in english) [RESEARCH METHODOLOGY  IN NURSING, HYGIENE, EPIDEMIOLOGY AND PREVENTION (in english), INFORMATICS (in english)].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in nursing?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in nursing are: INTERNSHIP III (in english), SPECIALIST NURSING IN MATERNAL-PAEDIATRIC AREA - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [OBSTETRIC NURSING (in english), PEDIATRIC NURSING (in english)], CRITICAL CARE AND INTENSIVE MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [ANESTHESIOLOGY, CARDIOLOGY (in english)], NURSING METHODOLOGY IN CRITICAL AND NEUROLOGICAL AREA C.I. (in english) [NEUROLOGICAL NURSING, NURSING METHODOLOGY IN CRITICAL CARE], OTHER ACTIVITIES (in english), LABORATORY (in english) and FORENSIC MEDICINE, DEONTOLOGY AND HEALTH SYSTEM MANAGEMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY (in english), HEALTH MANAGEMENT (in english), FORENSIC MEDICINE, Optional Educational Activities (ADO)].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in italian studies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in italian studies are: ITALIAN LITERATURE [ITALIAN MIDDLE AGE LITERATURE, ITALIAN LITERATURE OF THE RENAISSANCE], ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS LABORATORY - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2, ITALIAN LANGUAGE TEACHING METHODOLOGY and ITALIAN LITERATURE TEACHING METHODOLOGY. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: THEORETICAL LINGUISTICS, LATIN LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE (SEMINAR), METHODS AND ISSUES OF COMPARATIVE LITERARY STUDIES. A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in audioprothesic techniques?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in audioprothesic techniques are: FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH) (in english), PHYSICS AND BIOCHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOCHEMISTRY, ACOUSTIC PHYSICS], GENERAL AUDIOLOGY, HUMAN ANATOMY, SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY OF MATERIALS, HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE I, AUDIOLOGICAL SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [AUDIOLOGY - ADULTS, GENERAL AND PROSTHETIC AUDIOMETRY] and BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [COMPUTER SCIENCE, MEDICAL STATISTICS].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in audioprothesic techniques?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in audioprothesic techniques are: INTERNAL MEDICINE, GENERAL SURGERY AND PHARMACOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL SURGERY, INTERNAL MEDICINE, PHARMACOLOGY, HEARING AIDS I, HEARING AIDS II], AUDIOLOGICAL SCIENCES II - INTEGRATED COURSE [CHILD AUDIOLOGY, OTORHINOLARYNGOLOGY], GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY, NEUROSCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [NEUROLOGY, OTONEUROLOGY], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE II, SPECIALIST PROFESSIONAL WORKSHOP and INFORMATION PROCESSING SYSTEMS.  A thesis is also expected to be conducted.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in audioprothesic techniques?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in audioprothesic techniques are: INTERDISCIPLINARY SCIENCES  - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, OTOSURGERY], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  III [COCHLEAR IMPLANTS, HEARING AIDS III], BUSINESS ECONOMICS, PSYCHIATRY, SCIENCE OF PREVENTION AND HEALTH SERVICES - INTEGRATED COURSE [OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE, INDUSTRIAL AUDIOLOGY], OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES and TINNITUS, HYPERACUSIS AND DISORDERS OF HEARING PROCESS [ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - palermo?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - palermo are: PRIVATE LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [SPORTS LAW, ELEMENTS OF PRIVATE LAW], GENERAL AND SPECIAL PEDAGOGY [SPECIAL PEDAGOGY AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY, GENERAL PEDAGOGY], HUMAN MORPHOLOGY AND BIOMECHANICS [HUMAN ANATOMY I, ANALYSIS OF MOVEMENT], HUMAN MORPHOLOGY AND NEURO-MOTILITY [THEORY AND METHODOLOGY OF HUMAN MOTION, HUMAN ANATOMY II] and GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT AND DISABILITY [PSYCHOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT AND DISABILITY, GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - palermo?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - palermo are: BIOCHEMISTRY, HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY I, HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY II], ELEMENTS OF PUBLIC LAW, APPLIED DIETETIC TECHNICAL SCIENCES, ENGLISH LANGUAGE II, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF  PREVENTIVE AND COMPENSATORY PHYSICAL EDUCATION, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF INDIVIDUAL SPORT ACTIVITIES and THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF SPORT GAMES. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, PHYSIOLOGY OF NUTRITION, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF TENNIS, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF MARTIAL ARTS, POSTURAL ASSESSMENT IN THE PREVENTION OF SPORTS TRAUMAS, RIGHT TO HEALTH AND TO CIVIL LIABILITY IN SPORT, EUROPEAN SPORT LAW, FIRST AID IN SPORTS, HISTORY OF PHYSICAL EDUCATION, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF FREE BODY TRAINING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF TWIRLING, INDOOR CYCLING, ELEMENTS OF STATISTICS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION, NEUROLOGY, EXPERIMENTAL PEDAGOGY, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF BASKETBALL, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF HANDBALL, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF FENCING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF SWIMMING ACTIVITIES, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF BADMINTON, PREVENTION AND HEALTH PROMOTION IN THE DEVELOPMENTAL AGE THROUGH PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGYOF KOSHIDO BUDO, GROUP PSYCHODYNAMIC IN SPORTS, ECONOMICS AN MANAGEMENT OF AMATEUR SPORT CLUBS AND ASSOCIATIONS, TECHNOLOGICAL INFORMATION  LAW AND COMPUTER DATA PROCESSING LAW IN SPORTS.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - palermo?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - palermo are: SPORTS MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [HYGIENE, SPORTS MEDICINE], PRACTICE, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF MOTORIAL ACTIVITIES FOR THE VARIOUS AGES-, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF ADAPTED MOTORIAL ACTIVITY, THEORY AND METHODOLOGY OF SPORT ACTIVITIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [MOTORIAL AND APTITUDE ASSESSMENT METHODS FOR SPORTS, THEORY AND METHODOLOGY OF SPORT TRAINING], SPORT BUSINESS ECONOMICS, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF FITNESS and ENGLISH LANGUAGE. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, PHYSIOLOGY OF NUTRITION, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF TENNIS, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF MARTIAL ARTS, POSTURAL ASSESSMENT IN THE PREVENTION OF SPORTS TRAUMAS, RIGHT TO HEALTH AND TO CIVIL LIABILITY IN SPORT, EUROPEAN SPORT LAW, FIRST AID IN SPORTS, HISTORY OF PHYSICAL EDUCATION, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF FREE BODY TRAINING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF TWIRLING, INDOOR CYCLING, ELEMENTS OF STATISTICS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION, NEUROLOGY, EXPERIMENTAL PEDAGOGY, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF BASKETBALL, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF HANDBALL, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF FENCING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF SWIMMING ACTIVITIES, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF BADMINTON, PREVENTION AND HEALTH PROMOTION IN THE DEVELOPMENTAL AGE THROUGH PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGYOF KOSHIDO BUDO, GROUP PSYCHODYNAMIC IN SPORTS, ECONOMICS AN MANAGEMENT OF AMATEUR SPORT CLUBS AND ASSOCIATIONS, TECHNOLOGICAL INFORMATION  LAW AND COMPUTER DATA PROCESSING LAW IN SPORTS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in energy engineering and renewable energies curriculum energy?
