answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in energy engineering and renewable energies curriculum energy are: SUSTAINABLE ENERGY SOLUTIONS FOR BUILDINGS - INTEGRATED COURSE [BUILDING ENERGETICS AND CERTIFICATIONS, ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL AND TECHNOLOGIES FOR ZERO ENERGY BUILDINGS], INDUSTRIAL APPLICATIONS OF RENEWABLE ENERGIES, THERMAL TECHNIQUE EQUIPMENT AND MEASUREMENTS, COMPONENTS FOR ELECTRIC POWER SYSTEMS and ENERGY PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT. stage/intership and free subjects are also included. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum historical knowledge criticism?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum historical knowledge criticism are: ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, INTERNSHIP and ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: THEORETICAL PHILOSOPHY, PHILOSOPHY OF VERBAL PRACTICES, ETHICS, LANGUAGES AND GRAMMARS OF POWER. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: HISTORY OF DEMOCRATISATION PROCESSES,  PHILOSOPHY OF SOCIAL SCIENCES, POLITICS AND CONFLICTS (XVII-XX CENTURIES). It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VI: SOCIAL AND POLITICAL HISTORY OF ANCIENT GREECE, MODELS OF DEMOCRACY, ANCIENT ROME SOCIAL AND POLITICAL HISTORY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum historical knowledge criticism?
answer: As for the second year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum historical knowledge criticism is tional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: SOCIAL FORMS AND HIERARCHIES OF THE XIII-XVII CENTURIES, HISTORY OF GENDER RELATIONS (XV-XIX CENTURIES), POLITICAL AND SOCIAL HISTORY OF THE BYZANTINE WORLD, GENERAL PEDAGOGY (ADVANCED LEVEL), HISTORY OF THE POST-COLONIAL WORLD, LANGUAGES, SYMBOLS AND IDENTITY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: PHILOSOPHY OF SCIENCE, METAPHYSICS, EPISTEMOLOGY AND ANALYTICAL PHILOSOPHY, CONTEMPORARY AESTHETICS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in dietistics curriculum dietetics?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in dietistics curriculum dietetics are: BIOMEDICAL SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY, HUMAN ANATOMY WITH ELEMENTS OF HISTOLOGY], BIOLOGY AND NUTRITION - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOLOGY, BASIC DIETARY AND NUTRIGENOMICS SCIENCE], BASIC AND NUTRITION SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [DIETARY SCIENCE FOR COMMUNITY, BIOCHEMISTRY, PHYSICS APPLIED TO NUTRITION], FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH), MICROBIOLOGY AND GENERAL PATHOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GASTROENTEROLOGY I, MICROBIOLOGY AND CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY, GENERAL PATHOLOGY], FOOD CHEMISTRY AND PRODUCTION - INTEGRATED COURSE [FOOD CHEMISTRY, VEGETAL FOOD AND PRODUCTS] and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE I.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in dietistics curriculum dietetics?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in dietistics curriculum dietetics are: MEDICAL AND SURGICAL  SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [TECHNICAL DIETETIC SCIENCEFOR CLINICAL NUTRITION, GENERAL SURGERY, INTERNAL MEDICINE], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE II, PSYCHIATRY AND ANTHROPOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PSYCHIATRY, DEMOETHNOANTHROPOLOGICAL STUDIES], IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  III, HUMAN SCIENCES AND NUTRITION OVER THE LIFE CYCLE- INTEGRATED COURSE [PAEDIATRICS, CARDIOVASCULAR SYSTEM DISEASES, PHYSICAL AND REHABILITATION MEDICINE IN THE NUTRITIONAL AREA] and MEDICAL AND DIETARY SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED TECHNICAL  DIETETIC SCIENCES FOR PATHOPHYSIOLOGY AND CLINICAL METHODOLOGY, GASTROENTEROLOGY II, ENDOCRINOLOGY].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in dietistics curriculum dietetics?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in dietistics curriculum dietetics are: STATISTICS AND COMPUTER SCIENCE - INTEGRATED COURSE [INFORMATION PROCESSING SYSTEMS, MEDICAL STATISTICS], OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, DIETETICS, NUTRACEUTICALS AND ONCOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PHARMACOLOGY, MEDICAL ONCOLOGY, FOOD AND CHRONIC-DEGENERATIVE DISEASES], HYGIENE, BUSINESS ORGANISATION AND SOCIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL SOCIOLOGY, GENERAL AND APPLIED HYGIENE, BUSINESS ORGANISATION], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE IV, SPECIALIST PROFESSIONAL WORKSHOP, MEDICAL BEHAVIOURAL SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [DIETETICS METHODS IN MEDICAL-NUTRITIONAL CARE, PHYSICAL EDUCATION METHODS AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY] and INTERNSHIP V [ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum relationship and care?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum relationship and care are: CLINICAL NEUROPSYCHOLOGY, COGNITIVE NEUROSCIENCES, ENGLISH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2, PSYCHODYNAMICS OF DEVELOPMENT AND CLINICAL SET(TNGS) [PSYCHODINAMIC MODELS OF DEVELOPMENT AND CLINICAL SET(TINGS), CLINICAL SETTINGS OBSERVATION AND DESIGN], PROFESSIONAL DEONTOLOGY AND ETHICAL ISSUES (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE  PRACTICE), EXPERIENTIAL TRAINING GROUPS (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), PSYCHIATRY, PSYCHOLOGY OF ORGANISATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS, PLANNING OF CLINICAL-SOCIAL INTERVENTIONS (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), FORMULATION OF A CLINICAL CASE AND DIAGNOSTIC REPORT (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE) and PSYCHOPATHOLOGY AND PSYCHODIAGNOSTICS [PSYCHOPATHOLOGY, LABORATORY OF PSYCHODIAGNOSTICS].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum relationship and care?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum relationship and care are: PSYCHOTHERAPY, PATHOLOGICAL ADDICTION, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY OF HEALTH, EXTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE, RESEARCH METHODS IN CLINICAL PSTCHOLOGY (in english), PRACTICAL-EVALUATIVE TEST - DEGREE DISSERTATION and DISCUSSION OF CLINICAL CASES AND INTERVENTION TECHNIQUES (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE). optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: COGNITIVE PROFILES AND PSYCHO-PATHOLOGICAL DISORDERS (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGICAL INTERVENTION IN JURIDICAL PSYCHOLOGY (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), PSYCHODRAMA TECHNQIUES  (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), MIGRANTS AND MIGRATION: THE PSYCHOLOGIST'S ROLE (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), THE CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGISTS IN THE SCHOOL CONTEXT (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), TAKING CHARGE OF DEMENTIA PATIENTS (TPV LAB). It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ASSESSMENT AND TREATMENT OF AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS, SOCIAL AND AFFECTIVE NEUROSCIENCE, THEORY AND TECHNIQUE OF CLINICAL INTERVENTION WITH FAMILIES, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY OF ADOLESCENCE, PSYCHOLOGY OF THE MAFIA PHENOMENON, BEHAVIOURAL NEUROLOGY (in english), DISABILITY PSYCHODYNAMICS.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in architecture?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in architecture are: ARCHITECTURAL REPRESENTATION STUDIO, HISTORY OF ARCHITECTURE AND THE CITY I, MATHEMATICS 1 AND 2 - INTEGRATED COURSE [MATHEMATICS - MODULE 2, MATHEMATICS - MODULE 1], ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN STUDIO AND THEORY OF ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN - INTEGRATED COURSE [THEORY OF ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN, ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN STUDIO I], PRINCIPLES AND APPLICATIONS OF DESCRIPTIVE GEOMETRY - WORKSHOP and ENGLISH LANGUAGE. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in architecture?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in architecture are: ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNICAL PHYSICS, TOWN PLANNING AND TOWN PLANNING LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [TOWN PLANNING, TOWN PLANNING LAW], ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN STUDIO II, STATICS, INTERIOR DESIGN  AND DECORATION - STUDIO and HISTORY OF ARCHITECTURE AND THE CITY II. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESTORATION/CULTURAL HERITAGE REGULATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [RESTORATION RULES AND YARDS], RESTORATION RULES AND YARDS [ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESTORATION], ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESTORATION, HISTORY OF ART, MATERIALS AND TECHNIQUES OF EXISTING BUILDING ASSETS, PLANT ECOLOGY FOR ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the master degree in architecture?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the master degree in architecture are: DIGITAL REPRESENTATION STUDIO, TOWN PLANNING I AND TOWN AND REGIONAL GEOGRAPHY I - STUDIO [TOWN PLANNING - STUDIO, URBAN AND TERRITORIAL GEOGRAPHY], ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN III - STUDIO, MECHANICS OF MATERIALS AND THEORY OF STRUCTURES, ARCHITECTURAL BUILDING STUDIO AND TECHNICAL PLANTS OF BUILDINGS - INTEGRATED COURSE [TECHNICAL PLANTS OF BUILDINGS, ARCHITECTURAL BUILDING STUDIO] and THEORY AND HISTORY OF RESTORATION. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE AND HISTORY OF MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY ART - INTEGRATED COURSE [HISTORY OF MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY ART], HISTORY OF MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY ART [HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE], HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE AND AESTHETICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [AESTHETICS], AESTHETICS [HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE], HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE.

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in architecture?
answer: Subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in architecture are: OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, ENVIRONMENTAL VALUATION AND ECONOMICS, ENVIRONMENTAL DESIGN STUDIO, TOWN PLANNING II - STUDIO, INDUSTRIAL DESIGN, ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN IV- STUDIO, INTERNSHIP and CONSTRUCTION TECHNIQUE - DESIGN  STUDIO.

question: What are the subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in architecture?
answer: Subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in architecture are: GARDEN ART AND LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURE STUDIO, MONUMENT RESTORATION STUDIO and ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN V- STUDIO. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects V: ARCHITECTURE HISTORY  AND ANALYSIS METHODS, BUILDING REHABILITATION TECHNOLOGIES, INNOVATIVE ARCHITECTURAL SURVEY TECHNIQUES, PRINCIPLES OF BIM/PARAMETRIC MODELLING AND STRUCTURE ANALYSIS - INTEGRATED COURSE [STRUCTURE ANALYSIS], STRUCTURE ANALYSIS [PRINCIPLES OF BIM/PARAMETRIC MODELLING], PRINCIPLES OF BIM/PARAMETRIC MODELLING, HISTORY OF GARDENS AND LANDSCAPE, TECHNOLOGICAL REQUALIFICATION AND BUILDING MAINTENANCE - STUDIO. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in history, anthropology and geography curriculum historic?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in history, anthropology and geography curriculum historic are: CULTURAL GEOGRAPHY, HISTORY AND HISTORIOGRAPHY OF MEDIEVAL EUROPE, CULTURAL AND SOCIAL ANTHROPOLOGY, SOURCES AND METHODS OF HISTORICAL RESEARCH, ARCHIVISTICS, DIGITAL HUMANITIES WORKSHOP and ONLINE BIBLIOGRAPHY AND SOCIAL RESEARCH . WORKSHOP. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: CULTURAL HISTORY OF MODERN EUROPE, CULTURAL HISTORY OF THE MIDDLE AGES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: LATIN HISTORIOGRAPHICAL TEXTS OF THE MIDDLE AGES AND HUMANISM, CULTURAL HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL ISLAM, EXEGESIS AND EDITING OF MEDIEVAL HISTORICAL SOURCES, BYZANTINE CIVILISATION: SOURCES AND HISTORIOGRAPHY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in history, anthropology and geography curriculum historic?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in history, anthropology and geography curriculum historic are: ECONOMIC HISTORY, INTERNSHIP, ENGLISH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2 and HISTORY OF CHIRCH AND RELIGIOUS MOVEMENTS. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: HISTORY  TEACHING METHODOLOGY, CONTEMPORARY HISTORY, HISTORY OF POLITICAL THOUGHT AND INSTITUTIONS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - trapani?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - trapani are: PRIVATE LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [SPORTS LAW, ELEMENTS OF PRIVATE LAW], HUMAN MORPHOLOGY AND BIOMECHANICS [HUMAN ANATOMY I, ANALYSIS OF MOVEMENT], GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT AND DISABILITY [PSYCHOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT AND DISABILITY, GENERAL PSYCHOLOGY], GENERAL AND SPECIAL PEDAGOGY [SPECIAL PEDAGOGY AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY, GENERAL PEDAGOGY] and HUMAN MORPHOLOGY AND NEURO-MOTILITY [HUMAN ANATOMY II, THEORY AND METHODOLOGY OF HUMAN MOTION].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - trapani?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - trapani are: BIOCHEMISTRY, HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY I, HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY II], ELEMENTS OF PUBLIC LAW, APPLIED DIETETIC TECHNICAL SCIENCES, ENGLISH LANGUAGE, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF  PREVENTIVE AND COMPENSATORY PHYSICAL EDUCATION, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF INDIVIDUAL SPORT ACTIVITIES and THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF SPORT GAMES. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF FREE BODY TRAINING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF PILATES, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF TWIRLING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF CYCLING, EXPERIMENTAL PEDAGOGY, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGYOF KOSHIDO BUDO.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - trapani?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in physical education and sport sciences curriculum physical education and sport sciences - trapani are: SPORTS MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [HYGIENE, SPORTS MEDICINE], PRACTICE, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF MOTORIAL ACTIVITIES FOR THE VARIOUS AGES-, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF ADAPTED MOTORIAL ACTIVITY, THEORY AND METHODOLOGY OF SPORT ACTIVITIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [MOTORIAL AND APTITUDE ASSESSMENT METHODS FOR SPORTS, THEORY AND METHODOLOGY OF SPORT TRAINING], SPORT BUSINESS ECONOMICS, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY  OF FITNESS and ENGLISH LANGUAGE II. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF FREE BODY TRAINING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF PILATES, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF TWIRLING, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGY OF CYCLING, EXPERIMENTAL PEDAGOGY, THEORY, TECHNIQUE AND TEACHING METHODOLOGYOF KOSHIDO BUDO.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in aerospace engineering?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in aerospace engineering are: CHEMISTRY, GEOMETRY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE (in english), MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS - INTEGRATED COURSE [MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2, MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1], COMPUTER AIDED DESIGN, PHYSICS I, PRINCIPLES OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND PROGRAMMING and PRINCIPLES OF AEROSPACE ENGINEERING. stage/intership is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in aerospace engineering?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in aerospace engineering are: MECHANICS OF MATERIALS AND THEORY OF STRUCTURES, GENERAL TECHNOLOGIES OF MATERIALS, PHYSICS II, AEROSPACE ECONOMICS, ELECTRICAL DEVICES AND CIRCUITS, TECHNICAL PHYSICS and AERODYNAMICS AND PRINCIPLES OF CFD.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in aerospace engineering?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in aerospace engineering are: SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY  OF MATERIALS, AEROSPACE CONSTRUCTIONS AND STRUCTURES, AEROSPACE PRODUCTION TECHNOLOGIES, ATMOSPHERIC AND SPACE FLIGHT MECHANICS and CONSTRUCTION ELEMENTS AND MECHANICAL MEASUREMENTS - INTEGRATED COURSE [MECHANICAL MEASUREMENTS, CONSTRUCTION ELEMENTS]. stage/intership and free subjects are also included. A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in pedagogy curriculum education and planning?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in pedagogy curriculum education and planning are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE and DOCIMOLOGY WITH DOCIMOLOGY WORKSHOP [LABORATORY, DOCIMOLOGY]. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: HISTORY OF PHILOSOPHY (ADVANCED COURSE), THEORETICAL PHILOSOPHY  (ADVANCED COURSE), PHILOSOPHY OF LANGUAGE AND MIND, PHILOSOPHICAL ANTHROPOLOGY FOR EDUCATION, HISTORICAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY AND COGNITIVE SCIENCES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: COMMUNITY PEDAGOGY AND MODELS OF ADULT EDUCATION, PEDAGOGY OF FAMILY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PAEDAGOGY, TEACHING METHODS AND STRATEGIES (in english), PEDAGOGICAL CO-ORDINATION IN SOIO-EDUCATIONAL SERVICES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: NARRATIVITY EDUCATION IN CINEMA, SOCIOLOGY OF CHILDHOOD AND MEDIA LITERACY EDUCATION, PARTICIPATIVE PROCESSES PSYCHODINAMICS, MANAGEMENT OF EDUCATIONAL SYSTEMS AND RELATIONSHIP WITH THE TERRITORY, INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION AND DEVELOPMENT, PSYHCOLOGY OF ORGANISATIONS AND TRAINING. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: PREVENTION AND PROMOTION OF HEALTH IN THE DEVELOPMENTAL AGE, CULTURE AND LITERATURE OF MODERN GREECE.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in pedagogy curriculum education and planning?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in pedagogy curriculum education and planning are: ADDITIONAL PROFESSIONALIZING KNOWLEDGE AND SOFT SKILLS, EDUCATION THEORIES, STRATEGIES AND SYSTEMS and EDUCATIONAL PLANNING AND EVALUATION. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VI: ANTHROPOLOGY OF THE CONTEMPORARY AGE, PSYCHODYNAMICS OF PRISON SERVICE AND EXTERNAL CRIMINAL EXECUTION, PROJECT CYCLE MANAGEMEN FOR EDUCATION AND TRAINING, SOCIOLOGY OF GENDER STUDIES AND FEMALE THOUGHT. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VII: PHILOSOPHY OF COMMUNICATION, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ITALIAN PHILOSOPHY, HISTORY OF EDUCATION. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VIII: GENDER STUDIES, CLASS GROUP PSYCHODYNAMICS AND HEALTH AND WEILLBEING PROMOTION AT SCHOOL, PAEDIATRIC PSYCHOLOGY, PSYCHOLOGY OF FAMILY, MARGINALITY AND DEVIANCE, NARRATIVITY EDUCATION, PROTECTION OF RELIGIOUS AND CULTURAL PLURALISM, SOCIOLOGY OF FAMILY AND DIGITAL MEDIA.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in pharmacy?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in computer science?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in computer science are: CALCULUS [MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS I, MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS II], GEOMETRY, PROGRAMMING AND LABORATORY - INTEGRATED COURSE [STRUCTURED C PROGRAMMING, ABSTRACT DATA STRUCTURES], DISCRETE MATHEMATICS, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, PHYSICS and COMPUTER ARCHITECTURES.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in computer science?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in computer science are: DATA BASES, PROBABILITY THEORY, PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES, THEORETICAL COMPUTER SCIENCE, NUMERICAL ANALYSIS, ALGORITHMS AND DATA STRUCTURES, OPERATING SYSTEMS and FUNDAMENTALS OF DATA SCIENCE.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in computer science?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in computer science are: COMPUTER  NETWORKS, ARTIFICIAL VISION, SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AND SECURITY, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, ALGORITHMS - LABORATORY and WEB AND MOBILE DEVELOPMENT WITH FRONT-END ELEMENTS. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: EDUCATIONAL METHODOLOGIES AND TECHNIQUES FOR COMPUTER SCIENCE, OPEN DATA MANAGEMENT (in english). question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in diagnostic technical health professions curriculum diagnostic technical health professions science?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in diagnostic technical health professions curriculum diagnostic technical health professions science are: PRINCIPLES AND TOOLS OF BUSINESS ECONOMICS APPLIED TO HEALTHCARE - INTEGRATED COURSE [BUSINESS ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT, BUSINESS ECONOMICS AND ORGANISATION], PSYCHOLOGY APPLIED TO SOCIAL RTELATIONS, COMMUNICATION AND GROUP DYNAMICS . INTEGRATED COURSE [SOCIOLOGY OF CULTURAL AND COMMUNICATION PROCESSES IN THE WORKPLACE, OCCUPATIONAL AND ORGANISATIONAL PSYCHOLOGY], STATISTICS, EPIDEMIOLOGY AND BIOETICS - INTEGRATED  COURSE [STATISTICS FOR EPIDEMIOLOGY AND RESEARCH, GENERAL AND APPLIED HYGIENE, BIOETHICS], EDUCATION SCIENCE . INTEGRATED COURSE [TRAINING IN HEALTHCARE ACCREDITATION AND EVALUATION, METHODOLOGICAL BASES FOR LIFELONG LEARNING IN HEALTHCARE], RESEARCH AND INNOVATION METHODOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HEALTH RESEARCH METHODOLOGY, INFORMATION PROCESSING SYSTEMS, SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH TECHNOLOGY], HEALTH LAW AND JURIDICAL ETHIC-PROFESSIONAL LIABILITY - INTEGRATED COURSE [LABOUR LAW IN THE EUROPEAN UNION, FORENSIC MEDICINE AND PROFESSIONAL LIABILITY], PRACTICE MED/50 - I YEAR and PRACTICE MED/46 - I YEAR.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in diagnostic technical health professions curriculum diagnostic technical health professions science?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in diagnostic technical health professions curriculum diagnostic technical health professions science are: FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH) (in english), INTERDISCIPLINARY PROFESSIONALIZING PATH I - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED PHYSICS, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY], INTERDISCIPLINARY PROFESSIONALIZING PATH II - INTEGRATED COURSE [ORGANIZATIONAL AND MANAGERIAL MODELS OF TECHNICAL-DIAGNOSTC SERVICES, CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY, CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY], DIAGNOSTIC TECHNIQUES - LABORATORY, MED/50 PRACTICE II YEAR - I SEMESTER, MED/46 PRACTICE II YEAR - I SEMESTER, INTERDISCIPLINARY PROFESSIONALIZING PATH V- INTEGRATED COURSE [HEALTH TECHNOLOGY ASSESSMENT, OMICS SCIENCES IN DIAGNOSTICS], INTERDISCIPLINARY PROFESSIONALIZING PATH III - INTEGRATED COURSE [AUDIOLOGY, APPLIED DIETETIC TECHNICAL SCIENCES], INTERDISCIPLINARY PROFESSIONALIZING PATH IV- INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL ONCOLOGY, CLINICAL RISK MANAGEMENT], MED/46 PRACTICE II YEAR - II SEMESTER and MED/50 PRACTICE II YEAR - II SEMESTER [ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum neuropsychology?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum neuropsychology are: CLINICAL NEUROPSYCHOLOGY, COGNITIVE NEUROSCIENCES, ENGLISH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2, PSYCHODYNAMICS OF DEVELOPMENT AND CLINICAL SET(TNGS) [CLINICAL SETTINGS OBSERVATION AND DESIGN, PSYCHODINAMIC MODELS OF DEVELOPMENT AND CLINICAL SET(TINGS)], PROFESSIONAL DEONTOLOGY AND ETHICAL ISSUES (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE  PRACTICE), EXPERIENTIAL TRAINING GROUPS (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), PSYCHIATRY, PSYCHOLOGY OF ORGANISATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS, PLANNING OF CLINICAL-SOCIAL INTERVENTIONS (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), FORMULATION OF A CLINICAL CASE AND DIAGNOSTIC REPORT (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE) and PSYCHOPATHOLOGY AND PSYCHODIAGNOSTICS [PSYCHOPATHOLOGY, LABORATORY OF PSYCHODIAGNOSTICS].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum neuropsychology?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in clinical psychology curriculum neuropsychology are: PSYCHOTHERAPY, NEUROPSYCHOLOGICAL EVALUATION TECHNIQUES, NEUROPSYCHOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT, EXTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE, NEUROPSYCHOLOGICAL DISORDERS REHABILITATION, PRACTICAL-EVALUATIVE TEST - DEGREE DISSERTATION and DISCUSSION OF CLINICAL CASES AND INTERVENTION TECHNIQUES (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE). optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: COGNITIVE PROFILES AND PSYCHO-PATHOLOGICAL DISORDERS (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGICAL INTERVENTION IN JURIDICAL PSYCHOLOGY (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), PSYCHODRAMA TECHNQIUES  (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), MIGRANTS AND MIGRATION: THE PSYCHOLOGIST'S ROLE (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), THE CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGISTS IN THE SCHOOL CONTEXT (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), TAKING CHARGE OF DEMENTIA PATIENTS (TPV LAB). It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ASSESSMENT AND TREATMENT OF AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS, SOCIAL AND AFFECTIVE NEUROSCIENCE, THEORY AND TECHNIQUE OF CLINICAL INTERVENTION WITH FAMILIES, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY OF ADOLESCENCE, PSYCHOLOGY OF THE MAFIA PHENOMENON, BEHAVIOURAL NEUROLOGY (in english), DISABILITY PSYCHODYNAMICS.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in aerospace engineering?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in aerospace engineering are: GAS DYNAMICS (in english), AEROSPACE STRUCTURES, AERONAUTICAL PRODUCTION TECHNOLOGIES, AUTOMATIC CONTROL, AIRCRAFT CONCEPTUAL DESIGN (in english) and AEROSPACE PROPULSION (in english).

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in aerospace engineering?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in aerospace engineering are: FLIGHT DYNAMICS and AEROELASTICITY (in english). stage/intership, optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ESTIMATION, FILTERING AND SYSTEM IDENTIFICATION (in english), NUMERICAL ANALYSIS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in medical and image diagnostics and radiotherapy techniques?
context: 2165_MEDICAL AND IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY TECHNIQUES_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in medical and image diagnostics and radiotherapy techniques are: STATISTICS, IMAGE PROCESSING AND FILING, PHYSICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE PROCESSING AND FILING SYSTEMS, MEDICAL STATISTICS, GENERAL PHYSICS], HISTOLOGY, ANATOMY, BIOCHEMISTRY AND PHYSIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN PHYSIOLOGY, HUMAN ANATOMY WITH ELEMENTS OF HISTOLOGY, BIOCHEMISTRY], RADIOLOGICAL EQUIPMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS EQUIPMENT I, MEDICAL PHYSICS FOR RADIOPROTECTION, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS,  IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS TECHNIQUES I], FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH), PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR and GENERAL PATHOLOGY, HYGIENE AND INDUSTRIAL MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL PATHOLOGY, OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE, HYGIENE].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in medical and image diagnostics and radiotherapy techniques?
context: 2165_MEDICAL AND IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY TECHNIQUES_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in medical and image diagnostics and radiotherapy techniques are: IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS,  IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS TECHNIQUES II, PHARMACOLOGY, CONTRAST MEDIA AND ANAESTHESIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PHARMACOLOGY, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS,  CONTRAST RADIOLOGY, ANAESTHESIOLOGY], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  II YEAR, MEDICAL ONCOLOGY, RADIOTHERAPY AND NUCLEAR MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, RADIOTHERAPY, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, DIAGNOSTIC AND THERAPEUTICAL TECHNIQUES IN NUCLEAR MEDICINE, MEDICAL ONCOLOGY] and ORTHOPAEDICS, ODONTOSTOMATOLOGY AND FORENSIC MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [LOCOMOTOR SYSTEM DISEASES, FORENSIC MEDICINE, ODONTO-STOMATOLOGICAL DISEASES].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in medical and image diagnostics and radiotherapy techniques?
context: 2165_MEDICAL AND IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS AND RADIOTHERAPY TECHNIQUES_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in medical and image diagnostics and radiotherapy techniques are: OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS TECHNIQUES 3 - INTEGRATED COURSE [IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS, IMAGE DIAGNOSTIC TECHNIQUES V, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS,  IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS TECHNIQUES III, IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS,  IMAGE DIAGNOSTICS TECHNIQUES IV], HISTORY OF MEDICINE, PSYCHOLOGY AND BUSINESS ORGANISATION - INTEGRATED COURSE [OCCUPATIONAL AND ORGANISATIONAL PSYCHOLOGY, BUSINESS ORGANISATION, HISTORY OF MEDICINE], ADVANCED PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE ON HIGH TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT, COMPUTER SCIENCE LABORATORY and PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  III YEAR [ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in archaeology?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in archaeology are: LABORATORY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2 and FIELD ACTIVITY. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: POST-CLASSICAL ARCHAEOLOGY, GREEK ARCHAEOLOGY, PREHISTORY, GREEK AND ROMAN NUMISMATICS, ARCHAEOLOGY OF MAGNA GRAECIA AND SICILY, TOPOGRAPHY AND TOWN PLANNING IN THE ANCIENT WORLD, ROMAN ARCHAEOLOGY, ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORY OF ANCIENT ARCHITECTURE. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: BIO-ANTHROPOLOGICAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGIES, URBAN ARCHAEOLOGY, APPLIED CHEMISTRY FOR THE CULTURAL HERITAGE, PRINCIPLES OF  RESTORATION THEORY AND HISTORY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in archaeology?
answer: Subject of the second year of the master degree in archaeology is PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORY OF PALAEOCHRISTIAN ART, 3D SURVEY FOR ARCHAEOLOGY, FORTUNE OF CLASSICAL ART. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: GREEK EPIGRAPHY, LATIN EPIGRFAPHY, HISTORY OF GREEK SICILY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VI: VIRTUAL ARCHAEOLOGY, WORLD CULTURAL HERITAGE IN DANGER: THE MEDITERRANEAN AND NEAR EAST, LANDSCAPE ECOLOGY AND ARCHAEOBOTANY, ARCHAEOMETRY, PHOENCIAN-PUNIC ARCHAEOLOGY ITINERARIES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VII: GIS LABORATORY, 3D MODELLING WORKSHOP.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - chirone, ippocrate, hypatia?

answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in georisks and georesources are: APPLIED GEOCHEMISTRY, TECHNICAL GEOLOGY AND GEOTECHNICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ROCKS MECHANICS, TECHNICAL GEOLOGY], ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2, APPLIED GEOPHYSICS and STRUCTURAL GEOLOGY WITH FIELD ACTIVITY. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: MORPHOTECTONICS, APPLIED GEOMORPHOLOGY AND GEO-HYDROLOGICAL RISK. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: APPLIED PETROGRAPHY, VOLCANIC RISK. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: GEOSCIENCES  TEACHING METHODOLOGY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in georisks and georesources?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in georisks and georesources are: ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, SEMINARS HELD BY THE REGIONAL BOARD OF GEOLOGISTS and INTERNSHIP AND PRACTICE. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: MICROPALEONTOLOGY, SEDIMENTARY PETROGRAPHY, SEDIMENTOLOGY, CARSOLOGY AND SPELEOLOGY, VOLCANIC PETROLOGY WITH FIELD ACTIVITIES, HYDRAULIC RISK AND WATER BASIN MANAGEMENT, ADVANCED GIS APPLICATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [GEO-DATA ACCESS AND MANAGEMENT], GEO-DATA ACCESS AND MANAGEMENT [GIS ANALYSIS AND THEMATIC CARTOGRAPHY], GIS ANALYSIS AND THEMATIC CARTOGRAPHY, GEOTHERMAL ENERGY AND RENEWABLE ENERGIES, BASIN ANALYSIS APPLIED TO NATURAL RESOURCE STUDIES, ANALYSTICAL METHODS AND PETROLOGICAL MODELLING, SEISMOLOGY, ISOTOPE GEOCHEMISTRY, ENVIRONMENTAL GEOLOGY AND GIS ANALYSIS, VOLCANIC ACTIVITY SURVEILLANCE, PLANETOLOGY AND PLANETARY VOLCANISM, GEOPHYSICS FOR NON-DESTRUCCTIVE TESTS, INLAND AND MARINE WATERS GEOCHEMISTRY, SEISMIC RISK AND MICROZONATION, INTRODUCTION TO GEMMOLOGY.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in agroengineering and forestry sciences and technologies curriculum agricultural engineering sciences and technologies (lm-73)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in agroengineering and forestry sciences and technologies curriculum agricultural engineering sciences and technologies (lm-73) are: AGRI-ENVIRONMENTAL MICROBIOLOGY, REMOTE SENSING AND TERRITORIAL INFORMATION SYSTEMS and ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ASSESSMENT. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: AGRICULTURAL ARTHROPOD CONTROL AND FAUNAL INDICATORS, FOREST ARTHROPODS CONTROL AND FAUNAL PLANNING. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: SOILS AND QUALITY INDICATORS [AGRICULTURAL PEDOLOGY], AGRICULTURAL PEDOLOGY [SOIL QUALITY INDICATORS], SOIL QUALITY INDICATORS, SOIL EVALUATION AND RECOMPOSITION [SOIL EVALUATION], SOIL EVALUATION [RECOVERY OF DEGRADED AREAS], RECOVERY OF DEGRADED AREAS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: BUSINESS ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT AND FOREST VALUATION [FOREST VALUATION - WORKSHOP], FOREST VALUATION - WORKSHOP [ORGANISATION AND STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT OF AGRO-FOREST BUSINESS], ORGANISATION AND STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT OF AGRO-FOREST BUSINESS, EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY AND TERRITORIAL EVALUATION [EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY], EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY [LAND VALUATION WORKSHOP], LAND VALUATION WORKSHOP. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: AGRO-ENERGIES, APPLIED AGRO-METEOROLOGY, ENHANCEMENT OF RURAL VILLAGES, PHYTOPATHOLOGICAL DIAGNOSTICS, NATURALISTIC ENGINEERING TECHNIQUES, GREEN MARKETING AND ENVIRONMENTAL CERTIFICATIONS.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies are: COMPUTING SKILLS, ANIMAL AND PLANT BIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANIMAL BIOLOGY, PLANT BIOLOGY], GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, PHYSICS WITH ELEMENTS OF MATHEMATICS, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, HUMAN ANATOMY, PHARMACOLOGY AND PHARMACOGNOSIS, GENERAL MICROBIOLOGY and ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies are: PHARMACEUTICAL ANALYSIS OF DRUGS, ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, BIOCHEMISTRY, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY AND SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS - INTEGRATED COURSE [SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY] and BIOCHEMICAL AND MOLECULAR APPLICATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOCHEMICAL METHODOLOGIES, MOLECULAR BIOCHEMISTRY].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies are: FOOD CHEMISTRY, PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGY AND PREFORMULATION PRINCIPLES, GENERAL PHYSIOLOGY, PATHOLOGY (MEDICAL TERMINOLOGY), DRUG ANALYSIS, PHARMACEUTICAL AND TOXICOLOGICAL CHEMISTRY  1, PHARMACOLOGY AND PHARMACOTHERAPY and PHARMACEUTICAL FORMS TECHNOLOGY AND DRUG REGULATIONS.

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies?
answer: Subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies are: MEDICINAL AND TOXICOLOGICAL CHEMISTRY  2, SPECIAL METHODOLOGIES IN PHARMACEUTICAL ANALYSIS, PHARMACOLOGY AND TOXICOLOGY, INDUSTRIAL DRUG PRODUCTION AND BUSINESS ECONOMICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [INDUSTRIAL DRUG PRODUCTION, BUSINESS ECONOMICS], PRACTICAL EVALUATION INTERNSHIP (TPV) I and ADVANCED MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY AND DRUG DESIGN - INTEGRATED COURSE [DRUG DESIGN, ADVANCED PHARMACEUTICAL CHEMISTRY].

question: What are the subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies?
answer: Subjects of the fifth year of the master degree in chemistry and pharmaceutical technologies curriculum pharmaceutical chemistry and technologies are: PRACTICAL EVALUATION INTERNSHIP (TPV) II and APPLIED PHARMACEUTUAL TECHNOLOGY AND PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGY IN NANO-MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [APPLIED PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGY, PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGY IN NANO-MEDICINE]. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: PHARMACOLOGICAL BIOTECHNOLOGIES, ADVANCED METHODOLOGIES IN  PHARMACEUTICAL CHEMISTRY, CHEMISTRY OF NATURAL BIOACTIVE SUBSTANCES, BIOMATERIALS FOR DRUG DELIVERY AND MEDICAL DEVICES.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit are: PHYSICS 1, MATHEMATICS I, GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, GENERAL CHEMISTRY], BIOLOGY, EMBRYOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOLOGY, EMBRYOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY], GENETICS AND MICROBIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL MICROBIOLOGY, GENETICS] and COMPUTER SCIENCE, BIOINFORMATICS AND TECHNICAL-SCIENTIFIC ENGLISH LANGUAGE - INTEGRATED COURSE [TECHNICAL SCIENTIFIC ENGLISH LANGUAGE, COMPUTER SCIENCE AND BIOINFORMATICS, ADO Group of subjects]. integrative subjects for biomedic engineering is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for integrative subjects for biomedic engineering: COMPUTER AIDED DESIGN, ELECTROTECHNICS AND ELECTRONICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [ELECTRONICS], ELECTRONICS [ELECTRICAL DEVICES AND CIRCUITS], ELECTRICAL DEVICES AND CIRCUITS, THERMODYNAMICS AND TRASNPORTATION PHENOMENA, SOLID MECHANICS AMD PROPERTIES OF MATERIALS FOR BIOMEDICAL APPLICATIONS - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOLID MECHANICS], SOLID MECHANICS [PROPERTIES OF BIOMATERIALS], PROPERTIES OF BIOMATERIALS, BIOMEDICAL EQUIPMENT.

question: What are the subjects of the fourth year of the master degree in medicine and surgery curriculum medicine and surgery - medit?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in tourism, territories and businesses curriculum tourism, territory and companies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in tourism, territories and businesses curriculum tourism, territory and companies are: BUSINESS ECONOMICS, SOCIOLOGY OF TOURISM, PRINCIPLES OF LAW, BASIC MATHEMATICAL AND DIGITAL KNOWLEDGE, MUSEOLOGY AND MANAGEMENT OF  MUSEUM ASSETS, GEOGRAPHY, CULTURAL AND ENVIROMENTAL HERITAGE and ELEMENTS OF ECONOMICS. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: FRENCH LANGUAGE (in french), SPANISH LANGUAGE (in spanish).

answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in tourism, territories and businesses curriculum tourism, territory and companies are: BUSINESS ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT, STATISTICS, TRANSPORT AND TOURISM LAW, INTERNSHIP, TOURISM ECONOMICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [TOURIST DESTINATION ECONOMICS, TOURISM ECONOMICS], HUMAN RESOURCES ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT IN TOURISM, ENGLISH LANGUAGE IN TOURIST CONVERSATION and PLANNING AND CONTROL IN TOURISM COMPANIES. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: DIGITAL MARKETING WORKSHOP, EXPERIENCE-BASED TOURISM WORKSHOP.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in tourism, territories and businesses curriculum tourism, territory and companies?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in tourism, territories and businesses curriculum tourism, territory and companies are: ENGLISH LANGUAGE AND CULTURE IN TOURISM DISCOURSE (in english), TALENT MANAGEMENT AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT, ECONOMIC AND TOURISM POLICY, MARKETING and STATISTICS FOR ECONOMY AND TOURISM - INTEGRATED COURSE [TOURISM STATISTICS, ECONOMIC STATISTICS]. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: ECONOMICS OF CULTURE.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum public and private administration management and organisation?
context: 2298_PUBLIC AND PRIVATE ADMINISTRATION MANAGEMENT AND ORGANISATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum public and private administration management and organisation are: ELEMENTS OF PUBLIC LAW, ENGLISH LANGUAGE AND TRANSLATION, PRIVATE AND DIGITAL INNOVATION LAW and THEORY AND HISTORY OF POLITICAL ECONOMICS. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: SPORTS LAW, MODERN HISTORY, GENERAL SOCIOLOGY AND SOCIAL PLANNING.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum public and private administration management and organisation?
context: 2298_PUBLIC AND PRIVATE ADMINISTRATION MANAGEMENT AND ORGANISATION_piano_studi_en.txt
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum public and private administration management and organisation are: LABOUR LAW, POLITICAL SCIENCE AND PUBLIC POLICIES ANALYSIS, ETHICS AND POLITICAL PHILOSOPHY, ADMINISTRATIVE LAW AND PUBLIC ACCOUNTING [ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, PUBLIC ACCOUNTING], CRIMINAL LIABILITY OF THE ORGANISATION [PROCEDURAL ASPECTS (MODULE), SUBSTANTIAL ASPECTS (MODULE)], MACROECONOMICS and BUSINESS ECONOMICS AND DIGITAL BUSINESS MODEL - INTEGRATED COURSE [DIGITAL BUSINESS MODEL (MODULE), BUSINESS ECONOMICS (MODULE)].

answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum public and private administration management and organisation are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, STRATEGIC HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGEMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN RESOURCES PROFESSIONAL LIFE CYCLE MANAGEMENT (MODULE), MODELS AND TECHNIQUES OF CORPORATE TRAINING (MODULE)], SOCIAL INNOVATION SOCIOLOGY, COMMERCIAL LAW, TAXATION LAW and SOCIAL STATISTICS. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in medical biotechnologies and molecular medicine?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in medical biotechnologies and molecular medicine are: OTHER LANGUAGE SKILLS, PROTEOMIC METHODOLOGIES AND BIOINFORMATICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [PRINCIPLES OF BIOINFORMATICS, PROTEOMIC METHODOLOGIES], CELL BIOCHEMISTRY AND EPIGENETICS OF METABOLIC PATHOLOGIES, MEDICAL-FORENSIC GENETICS AND MOLECULAR EPIDEMIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL AND FORENSIC GENETICS, MOLECULAR EPIDEMIOLOGY], MOLECULAR NEUROBIOLOGY AND NEUROLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENETICS OF CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM DISEASES, MOLECULAR NEUROBIOLOGY], MOLECULAR IMMUNOLOGY, DIAGNOSTIC AND THERAPEUTIC BIOTECHNOLOGIES IN MEDICAL ONCOLOGY and THEORY AND APPLICATIONS OF CELL MODELS.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in medical biotechnologies and molecular medicine?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in medical biotechnologies and molecular medicine are: CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY AND CLINICAL MOLECULAR BIOLOGY, BIOTECHNOLOGICAL APPLICATIONS IN MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [PHYSIOPATHOLOGICAL BASES OF HUMAN PATHOLOGIES AND CLINICAL APPLICATIONS OF BIOTECHNOLOGIES, HUMAN REPRODUCTION BIOTECHNOLOGIES], CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY, TISSUE BIOTECHNOLOGIES AND BIOMEDICAL NANOTECHNOLOGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIOTECHNOLOGIES IN THE SUBSTITUTION OF ORGANS AND TISSUES, NANOTECHNOLOGIES IN BIOMEDICINE] and PRACTICE [ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-data)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-data) are: BIG DATA - INTEGRATED COURSE [BIG DATA TECHNOLOGIES, ANALYSIS FOR BIG DATA], STATISTICAL MODELS AND DATA MINING - INTEGRATED COURSE [STATISTICAL MODELS, DATA MINING], STOCHASTIC PROCESSES AND STOCHASTIC NETWORKS - INTEGRATED COURSE [STOCHASTIC PROCESSES, NETWORKS AND OPTIMISATION], BAYESIAN STATISTICS AND NON-PARAMETRIC MODELS - INTEGRATED COURSE [BAYESIAN STATISTICS, NON PARAMETRIC MODELS] and PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-data)?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-data) are: ALGORITHMS AND DATA STRUCTURES and STATISTICAL METHODS FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL ANALYSIS - INTEGRATED COURSE [STATISTICAL METHODS FOR CONSTRUCTING INDICATORS, STATISTICS FOR ECONOMIC AND BUSINESS ANALYSIS]. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: BIOSTATISTICS, INTERNET, NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING, MODELS FOR CATGORIAL DATA, METHODS AND ANALYSIS FOR TERRITORIAL ECONOMIC DATA. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: INTERNSHIP, INTERNSHIP 3 CREDITS, STATISTICAL CONSULTING 2, STATISTICAL CONSULTING 3. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: BUSINESS ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT, ADVANCED ENGLISH (in english), UNCERTAIN REASONING AND PROBABILITY, STATISTICAL MACHINE LEARNING (in english), STATISTICAL MODELS FOR VOLATILITY IN FINANCE (in english), STATISTICAL LEARNING FOR HIGH DIMENSIONAL DATA (in english), PROGRAMMING, SOCIOLOGY, MATHEMATICS FOR ECONOMICS AND FINANCE (in english), ADVANCED SURVIVAL ANALYSIS (in english), TERRITORIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL DATA ANALYSIS, CLOUD COMPUTING (in english), NUMERICAL METHODS FOR THE EVALUATION OF DERIVATIVE SECURITIES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: INTERNSHIP, INTERNSHIP 6 CREDITS, INTERNSHIP 9 CREDITS, STATISTICAL CONSULTING, STATISTICAL CONSULTING 1.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in economics, international cooperation and sustainable development curriculum economic development, cooperation and migration?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in economics, international cooperation and sustainable development curriculum economic development, cooperation and migration are: COMPARATIVE LEGAL SYSTEMS, POLITICAL SCIENCE, MATHEMATICS FOR SOCIAL SCIENCES, ENGLISH LANGUAGE FOR INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION AND MIGRATIONS, BUSINESS ECONOMICS, APPLIED MICRO- AND MACROECONOMICS, CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY AND CONTEMPORARY WORLD - INTEGRATED COURSE [CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY AND CONTEMPORARY WORLD - MODULE 2, CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY AND CONTEMPORARY WORLD - MODULE 1] and GENERAL AND DEVELOPMENT SOCIOLOGY AND SOCIAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOCIAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY, GENERAL AND DEVELOPMENT SOCIOLOGY]. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in economics, international cooperation and sustainable development curriculum economic development, cooperation and migration?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in economics, international cooperation and sustainable development curriculum economic development, cooperation and migration are: STATISTICS, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, HISTORY OF POLITICAL IDEAS, INTERNATIONAL LAW AND MIGRATION LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [INTERNATIONAL LAW AND GLOBAL CHALLENGES, PERFORMING HUMAN RIGHTS AND MIGRATION LAW (in english)], NON-PROFIT AND MICROCREDIT ECONOMICS, SOCIOLOGY OF MIGRATION (in english) and ECONOMICS AND MIGRATION (in english). free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: THEATER FOR SOCIAL CHANGE (in english).

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in economics, international cooperation and sustainable development curriculum economic development, cooperation and migration?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in economics, international cooperation and sustainable development curriculum economic development, cooperation and migration are: ECONOMIC AND SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT POLICY - INTEGRATED COURSE [ECONOMIC AND EUROPEAN INTEGRATION POLICY, SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT ECONOMICS AND POLICY], DEVELOPMENT PLANS AND PROGRAMS - WORKSHOP, INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR DEVELOPMENYT and STATISTICS AND DEMOGRAPHY FOR MIGRATION - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [POPULATION, MIGRATIONS AND DEVELOPMENT, STATISTICAL METHODS FOR MIGRATION STUDIES (in english)]. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: ARAB LANGUAGE (in arabic), FRENCH LANGUAGE (in french), ENGLISH LANGUAGE (in english), RUSSIAN LANGUAGE (in russian), SPANISH LANGUAGE (in spanish), GERMAN LANGUAGE (in german), SPECIAL TOPIC (in english). It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: URBAN AND REGIONAL PLANNING FOR DEVELOPMENT (in english), AGRI FOOD SYSTEMS AND SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT (in english). It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: SPECIAL TOPIC IN MEDITERRANEAN AREA - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english), LAB OF ECONOMICS OF THE MEDITERRANEAN AREA (in english), LAB OF SOCIOLOGY OF THE MEDITERRANEAN AREA (in english).  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in social work curriculum social work - palermo?

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in health profession of prevention sciences curriculum lm/snt4 - health professions prevention science?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in health profession of prevention sciences curriculum lm/snt4 - health professions prevention science are: LEGAL SCIENCE AND OCCUPATIONAL MEDICINE - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL TOXICOLOGY, CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY, RISK ANALYSIS APPLICATIONS IN THE WORKPLACE], LEGAL AND ECONOMICAL SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, PLANNING AND CONTROL IN HEALTHCARE COMPANIES, LABOUR LAW], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  I  YEAR, OTHER LANGUAGE SKILLS (in english), APPLIED PEDAGOGICAL SCIENCES AND HEALTH PROMOTION - INTEGRATED COURSE [MEDICAL AN HEALTH PROFESSION ANTHROPOLOGY, SOCIOLOGY OF HEALTH] and SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH METHODOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL RESEARCH AND EBM, DATA MANAGEMENT, BIG DATA AND ELEMENTS OF COMPUTER SCIENCE, STATISTICS APPLIED TO EVALUATION IN HEALTHCARE].

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in health profession of prevention sciences curriculum lm/snt4 - health professions prevention science?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in health profession of prevention sciences curriculum lm/snt4 - health professions prevention science are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE  II YEAR, SCIENCE OF PREVENTION - INTEGRATED COURSE [HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING, HEALTH NEEDS ANALYSIS], OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PREVENTION AND NURSING SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [NURSING  SCIENCES, ELEMENTS OF PRIMARY AND SECONDARY PREVENTION IN PUBLIC HEALTH], HEALTH SERVICES MANAGEMENT AND RISK ASSESSMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [HEALTH SURVEILLANCE OF WORKERS AND OCCUPATIONAL RISKS, ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES], II LEVEL APPLIED TECHNICAL MEDICAL SCIENCES - INTEGRATED COURSE [EDUCATION IN HEALTHCARE, PREVENTION SCIENCE APPLIED TO HEALTHCARE] and ORGANISATIONAL MODELS IN HEALTHCARE - INTEGRATED COURSE [HEALTH EMERGENCIES MANAGEMENT, EVALUATION METHODOLOGIES IN HEALTHCARE, ADO Group of subjects].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in psychological sciences and techniques?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in psychological sciences and techniques are: PRINCIPLES AND HISTORY OF PSYCHOLOGY, PHYSIOLOGICAL PSYCHOLOGY, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PHILOSOPHY, BASIC COMPUTING SKILLS, BASIC SKILLS FOR QUANTITATIVE ANALYSIS, CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY, PSYCHOLOGY OF PERSONALITY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B1 and PSYCHOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT WITH MODELS AND TECHNIQUES OF BEHAVIOUR OBSERVATION IN THE LIFE CYCLE.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in psychological sciences and techniques?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in psychological sciences and techniques are: PSYCHOLOGY OF EDUCATION, DYNAMIC PSYCHOLOGY, SOCIAL STATISTICS, THEORY AND TECHNIQUES OF TESTS, PROFESSIONAL DEONTOLOGY - SEMINAR, OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES, PSYCHOLOGICAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGY, SOCIAL PSYCHOLOGY, TESTS IN PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT  (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE) and THE PSYCHOLOGIST'S RELATIONAL SKILLS  (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE).

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in psychological sciences and techniques?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in psychological sciences and techniques are: THEORIES AND TECHNOLOGIES OF PSYCHOLOGICAL INTERVIEW, PRINCIPLES OF PSYCHOPATHOLOGY, EXTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE, INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUES (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE), DESIGN OF INTERVENTIONS FOR THE PROMOTION OF WELLBEING/HEALTH  (INTERNAL EVALUATIVE PRACTICE) and OCCUPATIONAL AND ORGANISATIONAL PSYCHOLOGY. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: PSYCHODYNAMICS OF DREAM WITH WORKSHOP, SOCIAL PSYCHOLOGY OF INTER-GROUPS RELATIONS, BIOLOGY, NEUROPSYCHOLOGY, PSYCHODYNAMICS OF DEVELOPMENT AND FAMILY RELATIONS, THEORY AND TECHNIQUES OF GROUP DYNAMICS, PSYCHOLOGY OF THE MAFIA PHENOMENON.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in agroengineering and forestry sciences and technologies curriculum forestry sciences and technologies (lm-69)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in agroengineering and forestry sciences and technologies curriculum forestry sciences and technologies (lm-69) are: AGRI-ENVIRONMENTAL MICROBIOLOGY, FOREST GEOBOTANY and REMOTE SENSING AND TERRITORIAL INFORMATION SYSTEMS. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: AGRICULTURAL ARTHROPOD CONTROL AND FAUNAL INDICATORS, FOREST ARTHROPODS CONTROL AND FAUNAL PLANNING. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: SOILS AND QUALITY INDICATORS [SOIL QUALITY INDICATORS], SOIL QUALITY INDICATORS [AGRICULTURAL PEDOLOGY], AGRICULTURAL PEDOLOGY, SOIL EVALUATION AND RECOMPOSITION [RECOVERY OF DEGRADED AREAS], RECOVERY OF DEGRADED AREAS [SOIL EVALUATION], SOIL EVALUATION. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: BUSINESS ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT AND FOREST VALUATION [ORGANISATION AND STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT OF AGRO-FOREST BUSINESS], ORGANISATION AND STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT OF AGRO-FOREST BUSINESS [FOREST VALUATION - WORKSHOP], FOREST VALUATION - WORKSHOP, EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY AND TERRITORIAL EVALUATION [EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY], EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY [LAND VALUATION WORKSHOP], LAND VALUATION WORKSHOP. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: AGRO-ENERGIES, APPLIED AGRO-METEOROLOGY, ENHANCEMENT OF RURAL VILLAGES, PHYTOPATHOLOGICAL DIAGNOSTICS, REFORESTATION TECHNIQUES AND URBAN FORESTRY WORKSHOP, NATURALISTIC ENGINEERING TECHNIQUES, GREEN MARKETING AND ENVIRONMENTAL CERTIFICATIONS.

A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-82)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-82) are: BIG DATA - INTEGRATED COURSE [ANALYSIS FOR BIG DATA, BIG DATA TECHNOLOGIES], STATISTICAL MODELS AND DATA MINING - INTEGRATED COURSE [DATA MINING, STATISTICAL MODELS], STOCHASTIC PROCESSES AND STOCHASTIC NETWORKS - INTEGRATED COURSE [STOCHASTIC PROCESSES, NETWORKS AND OPTIMISATION], BAYESIAN STATISTICS AND NON-PARAMETRIC MODELS - INTEGRATED COURSE [BAYESIAN STATISTICS, NON PARAMETRIC MODELS] and PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-82)?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in statistics and data science curriculum statistical methods and data science (lm-82) are: ALGORITHMS AND DATA STRUCTURES and STATISTICAL METHODS FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL ANALYSIS - INTEGRATED COURSE [STATISTICAL METHODS FOR CONSTRUCTING INDICATORS, STATISTICS FOR ECONOMIC AND BUSINESS ANALYSIS]. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: BIOSTATISTICS, INTERNET, NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING, MODELS FOR CATGORIAL DATA, METHODS AND ANALYSIS FOR TERRITORIAL ECONOMIC DATA. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: INTERNSHIP, INTERNSHIP 3 CREDITS, STATISTICAL CONSULTING 2, STATISTICAL CONSULTING 3. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: BUSINESS ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT, ADVANCED ENGLISH (in english), UNCERTAIN REASONING AND PROBABILITY, STATISTICAL MACHINE LEARNING (in english), STATISTICAL MODELS FOR VOLATILITY IN FINANCE (in english), STATISTICAL LEARNING FOR HIGH DIMENSIONAL DATA (in english), PROGRAMMING, SOCIOLOGY, MATHEMATICS FOR ECONOMICS AND FINANCE (in english), ADVANCED SURVIVAL ANALYSIS (in english), TERRITORIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL DATA ANALYSIS, CLOUD COMPUTING (in english), NUMERICAL METHODS FOR THE EVALUATION OF DERIVATIVE SECURITIES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: INTERNSHIP, INTERNSHIP 6 CREDITS, INTERNSHIP 9 CREDITS, STATISTICAL CONSULTING, STATISTICAL CONSULTING 1.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in geology curriculum geological sciences?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in geology curriculum geological sciences are: GENERAL CHEMISTRY, MATHEMATICS, PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, INFORMATION LITERACY, PHYSICS, MINERALOGY WITH LABORATORY, STRATIGRAPHIC AND SEDIMENTARY GEOLOGY, GEO-INFORMATIC APPLICATIONS 1 and LABORATORRY AND FIELD SAFETY, ROKS AND WATERS LABORATORY, CARTOGRAPHY AND LAND.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in geology curriculum geological sciences?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in geology curriculum geological sciences are: EARTH PHYSICS, PALAEONTOLOGY WITH LABORATORY, GEOCHEMISTRY AND VOLCANOLOGY, GEO-INFORMATIC APPLICATIONS 2, FIELD TRIPS - II YEAR, GEOLOGICAL SURVEY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GEOLOGICAL SURVEYING FIELD, GEOLOGICAL SURVEY], GEOMORPHOLOGY WITH GEOMORPHOLOGICAL SURVEY and PETROGRAPHY WITH LABORATORY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PETROGRAPHY LABORATORY, PETROGRAPHY]. free subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in geology curriculum geological sciences?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in geology curriculum geological sciences are: GEOTECHNICS, PRACTICE, TECTONICS AND REGIONAL GEOLOGY, SEMINARS HELD BY THE REGIONAL BOARD OF GEOLOGISTS, GEOPHYSICAL METHODS, FIELD TRIPS - III YEAR, APPLIED GEOLOGY, GEORESOURCES AND GEOMATERIALS and HYDROGEOLOGY AND GIS LABORATORY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GIS LABORATORY, HYDROGEOLOGY]. free subjects is also included. A final examination is also scheduled.

answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in electronics engineering curriculum modern electronics are: HETEROSTRUCTURE DEVICES (in english),  APPLIED AND INDUSTRIAL ELECTRONICS - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [LABORATORY OF APPLIED AND INDUSTRIAL ELECTRONICS (in english), APPLIED ELECTRONICS (in english), INDUSTRIAL ELECTRONICS (in english)], OPTOELECTRONICS (in english), ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SYSTEMS (in english), ELECTRONIC INSTRUMENTS AND MEASUREMENTS FOR AUTOMATION AND TELECOMMUNICATIONS (in english), MICROWAVE ELECTRONICS - INTEGRATED COURSE (in english) [MICROWAVE COMPONENTS (in english), MICROWAVE CIRCUITS (in english)] and INTEGRATED OPTICS (in english). optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in agricultural sciences and technologies curriculum organic farming sciences?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in agricultural sciences and technologies curriculum organic farming sciences are: GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, FOREIGN LANGUAGE (ENGLISH) (in english), MATHEMATICS, ZOOLOGICAL TAXONOMY AND DEMOGRAPHY LABORATORY, SOFT SKILLS SEMINARS, GENERAL AND SYSTEMATIC BOTANY - INTEGRATED COURSE [PLANT MORPHOLOGY AND PHYSIOLOGY, SYSTEMATIC BOTANY], ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, AGRICULTURAL GENETICS and AGRONOMY AND AGRICULTURAL ECOLOGY. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: SUSTAINABLE BUSINESS MODELS IN THE AGRI-FOOD SECTOR (in english),  MACHINES AND PLANTS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (in english), ELEMENTS OF PEDO-LANDSCAPE CARTOGRAPHY, APIDOLOGY, BIOTECHNOLOGIES AND NURSERY FOR WOOD SPECIES, CHEMICAL-PHYSICAL SOIL ANALYSIS.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in agricultural sciences and technologies curriculum organic farming sciences?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in agricultural sciences and technologies curriculum organic farming sciences are: AGRICULTURAL MECHANICS AND MECHANISATION, SEMINARS, BUDGET PREPARATION AND ANALYSIS FOR THE AGRICULTURAL FIRM - LABORATORY, GENERAL ENTOMOLOGY AND BIOLOGICAL CONTROL OF ARTHROPODS, AGRO-ENVIRONMENTAL AND ORGANIC PRODUCTS ECONOMICS AND POLICY, AGRICULTURAL HYDRAULICS, ORGANIC FRUIT GROWING, SOIL CLASSIFICATION AND RECOGNITION LABORATORY and SOIL FERTILITY - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOIL FERTILITY, SOIL MICROBIOLOGY]. free subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects II: SUSTAINABLE BUSINESS MODELS IN THE AGRI-FOOD SECTOR (in english),  MACHINES AND PLANTS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (in english), ELEMENTS OF PEDO-LANDSCAPE CARTOGRAPHY, APIDOLOGY, BIOTECHNOLOGIES AND NURSERY FOR WOOD SPECIES, CHEMICAL-PHYSICAL SOIL ANALYSIS.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in agricultural sciences and technologies curriculum organic farming sciences?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in agricultural sciences and technologies curriculum organic farming sciences are: INTERNSHIP, ORGANIC ANIMAL PRODUCTIONS, LAND APPRAISAL, RENEWABLE ENERGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [AGRICULTURAL FARM AND RENEWABLE ENERGIES, TYPES AND ROLE OF ENERGY SOURCES], AGRI-FOOD TECHNOLOGIES, ORGANIC CROP SCIENCE, PLANT PATHOLOGY, ORGANIC HORTICULTURE and TECHNICAL ENGLISH LANGUAGE FOR AGRICULTURE.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in environmental science and technologies curriculum environment sciences and technologies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in environmental science and technologies curriculum environment sciences and technologies are: ANALYTICAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL METHODOLOGIES, ENVIRONMENTAL GEOLOGY AND GIS ANALYSIS (in english), MATHEMATICAL MODELS AND DATA ANALYSIS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (in english), ONE HEALTH, STRESS AND ENVIRONMENT (in english), POLLUTION PHENOMENA AND ENVIRONMENTAL RECLAMATION TECHNOLOGIES, PATTERNS AND PROCESSES FOR ECOLOGICAL ACCOUNTING OF SUSTAINABILITY (in english), REMOTE SENSING AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS (in english) and AIR POLLUTION. optional subjects is also included.

answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in environmental science and technologies curriculum environment sciences and technologies are: OTHER KNOWLEDGE USEFUL FOR JOB PLACEMENT, PRACTICE and ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND BIODIVERSITY LEGAL PROTECTION. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: ITALIAN LANGUAGE FOR FOREIGNERS, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2+. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in cooperation, development, migrations curriculum cooperation, development and migrations?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in cooperation, development, migrations curriculum cooperation, development and migrations are: HUMAN RIGHTS: THEORY AND POLICIES [HUMAN RIGHTS CONCEPTS AND THEORY, HUMAN RIGHTS IN DEVELOPMENT AND MIGRATION POLICIES], QUANTITATIVE METHODS & GIS FOR THE STUDY OF MIGRATION PHENOMENA (in english), ANTHROPOLOGY OF DEVELOPMENT (in english), HISTORY OF INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS, MIDDLE EAST AND NORTH AFRICA: HISTORY, POLITICS, CULTURES, DEVELOPMENT AND INTERNATIONAL ECONOMICS [INTERNATIONAL ECONOMICS, DEVELOPMENT AND INEQUALITIES], CRITICAL GEOGRAPHIES OF MIGRATIONS (in english) and PROGECT PLANNING FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (in english). optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in agroengineering and forestry sciences and technologies curriculum forestry sciences and technologies (lm-73)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in agroengineering and forestry sciences and technologies curriculum forestry sciences and technologies (lm-73) are: AGRI-ENVIRONMENTAL MICROBIOLOGY, FOREST GEOBOTANY and REMOTE SENSING AND TERRITORIAL INFORMATION SYSTEMS. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: AGRICULTURAL ARTHROPOD CONTROL AND FAUNAL INDICATORS, FOREST ARTHROPODS CONTROL AND FAUNAL PLANNING. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: SOILS AND QUALITY INDICATORS [SOIL QUALITY INDICATORS], SOIL QUALITY INDICATORS [AGRICULTURAL PEDOLOGY], AGRICULTURAL PEDOLOGY, SOIL EVALUATION AND RECOMPOSITION [SOIL EVALUATION], SOIL EVALUATION [RECOVERY OF DEGRADED AREAS], RECOVERY OF DEGRADED AREAS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: BUSINESS ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT AND FOREST VALUATION [ORGANISATION AND STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT OF AGRO-FOREST BUSINESS], ORGANISATION AND STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT OF AGRO-FOREST BUSINESS [FOREST VALUATION - WORKSHOP], FOREST VALUATION - WORKSHOP, EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY AND TERRITORIAL EVALUATION [EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY], EU AGRICULTURAL POLICY [LAND VALUATION WORKSHOP], LAND VALUATION WORKSHOP. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: AGRO-ENERGIES, APPLIED AGRO-METEOROLOGY, ENHANCEMENT OF RURAL VILLAGES, PHYTOPATHOLOGICAL DIAGNOSTICS, REFORESTATION TECHNIQUES AND URBAN FORESTRY WORKSHOP, NATURALISTIC ENGINEERING TECHNIQUES, GREEN MARKETING AND ENVIRONMENTAL CERTIFICATIONS.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in urban design for the city in transition?

AND ASSESSMENT TECHNIQUES AND PROCEDURES + URBAN PLANNING TECHNIQUES - INTEGRATED COURSE [S.E.A. AND ASSESSMENT TECHNIQUES AND PROCEDURES], S.E.A. AND ASSESSMENT TECHNIQUES AND PROCEDURES [TOWN PLANNING TECHNIQUE], TOWN PLANNING TECHNIQUE, LANDSCAPE ARCHAEOLOGY AND GIS + HISTORICAL PARKS AND GARDENS RESTORATION - INTEGRATED COURSE [HISTORICAL PARKS AND GARDENS RESTORATION], HISTORICAL PARKS AND GARDENS RESTORATION [LANDSCAPE ARCHAEOLOGY AND GIS], LANDSCAPE ARCHAEOLOGY AND GIS, CHALLENGES FOR TERRITORIES IN TRANSITION+TECHNOLOGICAL SOLUTIONS+PLACE BRANDING - STUDIO - INTEGRATED COURSE [CHALLENGES FOR TERRITORIES IN TRANSITION], CHALLENGES FOR TERRITORIES IN TRANSITION [TECHNOLOGICAL SOLUTIONS], TECHNOLOGICAL SOLUTIONS [PLACE BRANDING], PLACE BRANDING. question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in landscape architecture?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in landscape architecture are: LANDSCAPES AND CULTURES - INTEGRATED COURSE [HISTORY OF LANDSCAPE AND TERRITORY MAPPING, HISTORICAL GARDENS], LANDSCAPE AND TERRITORIAL ECOLOGY - INTEGRAED COURSE [LANDSCAPE ECOLOGY, TRADITIONAL RURAL LANDSCAPE AND CULTURAL HERITAGE], LANDSCAPE PLANNING STUDIO - INTEGRATED COURSE [SOILSCAPE ANALYSIS AND EVALUATION, LANDSCAPE PLANNING, METHODOLOGIES FOR LANDSCAPE ASSESSMENT] and LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURE STUDIO I - INTEGRATED COURSE [ARCHITECTURAL DESIGN STUDIO, TREES AND SHRUBS IN THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT]. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: GREEN SYSTEMS FOR SUSTAINABILITY IN URBAN ENVIRONMENT - LABORATORY, LANDSCAPE DESIGN TECHNIQUES IN THE CONTEMPORARY TOWN.

answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in landscape architecture are:  OPEN SPACES DESIGN STUDIO - INTEGRATED COURSE [OPEN SPACE DESIGN STUDIO, TREE LINES AND HEDGEROWS STUDIO], GREEN INFRASTRUCTURES AND BIODIVERSITY IN URBAN FOREST - INTEGRATED COURSE [ECOLOGIAL INFRASTRUCTURES AND ATRHROPOD DIVERSITY, URBAN FOREST AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURES], LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURE II - STUDIO, ENGLISH LANGUAGE, PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE and TECHNOLOGIES OF GREEN AREAS  AND URBAN HYDROLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [HYDROLOGY OF GREEN AREAS, GREEN TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT].  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in biotechnologies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in biotechnologies are: GENERAL AND INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, MATHEMATICS, PLANT BIOLOGY, CELL BIOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CELL BIOLOGY, CYTOLOGY AND HISTOLOGY], ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, APPLIED PHYSICS, SAFETY IN LABORATORIES AND IN THE WORKPLACE, BIOTECHNOLOGIES LAW, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1 and ANIMAL BIOLOGY.

answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in biotechnologies are: BIOCHEMISTRY, MOLECULAR BIOLOGY, BIOPHYSICS AND BIO-INSTRUMENTATION, GENETICS - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL AND MOLECULAR GENETICS, APPLIED MOLECULAR GENETICS], MICROBIOLOGY AND APPLIED BIOTECHNOLOGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [MOLECULAR BIOTECHNOLOGIES, GENERAL AND APPLIED MICROBIOLOGY] and RECOMBINANT TECHNOLOGIES.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in biotechnologies?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in biotechnologies are: HUMAN ANATOMY, PHYSIOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [GENERAL PHYSIOLOGY, PHYSIOLOGY OF NUTRITION], PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, AGRICULTURAL BIOECHNOLOGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [TREE FARMING, ZOOTECHNICS, HERBACEOUS CROPS] and PATHOLOGY AND IMMUNOLOGY - INTEGRATED COURSE [CLINICAL BIOCHEMISTRY, IMMUNOLOGY, PATHOLOGY AND GENERAL ONCOLOGY]. free subjects is also included. A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in physics?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in physics are: RADIATION-MATTER INTERACTION, ADVANCED QUANTUM MECHANICS, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, SPECTROSCOPY WITH LABORATORY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2+ and STATISTICAL PHYSICS (in english). optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: COMPUTATIONAL PHYSICS WITH LABORATORY (in english), BIOPHYSICS (in english), CONDENSED MATTER PHYSICS, INTRODUCTION TO MEDICAL PHYSICS, NANO-PARTICLES AND NANO-STRUCTURES (in english). It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: THEORY OF GENERAL RELATIVITY (in english), ASTROPHYSICS. answer: Subject of the second year of the master degree in physics is PRACTICE. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: NON-COMMUTATIVE ALGEBRA, PHYSICS TEACHING METHODOLOGY, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY OF MATERIALS, STELLAR EVOLUTION (in english), STAR FORMATION AND MAIN SEQUENCE (in english), POST MAIN SEQUENCE STARS AND SUPERNOVAE (in english), COMPLEX NETWORKS (in english), ASTROPHYSICS - LABORATORY (in english), PHYSICS OF COMPLEX SYSTEMS (in english), HIGH ENERGIES ASTROPHYSICS WITH LABORATORY (in english), SPACE WEATHER (in english), SOLAR PHYSICS (in english), SUN-EARTH INTERACTION (in english), CLOUD AND HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTING, GAUGE THEORIES (in english), RADIATION DETECTORS WITH LAB (in english), LAB OF PHYSICAL CHARACTERIZATION AND BIOSIGNAL PROCESSING (in english), LAB OF PHYSICS OF MATTER (in english), LAB OF RAMAN SPECTROSCOPY AND PARAMAGNETIC RESONANCE (in english), LAB OF TIME-RESOLVED SPECTROSCOPY (in english), BIOPHOTONICS WITH LABORATORY (in english), LAB OF BIOPHOTONICS (in english), INTRODUCTION TO BIOPHOTONICS AND WET LAB (in english), QUANTUM THERMODYNAMICS (in english), EQUILIBRIUM QUANTUM THERMODYNAMICS (in english), NON-EQUILIBRIUM QUANTUM THERMODYNAMICS (in english), STANDARD MODEL (in english), RENORMALIZATION AND PHYS BEYOND STD MODEL (in english), INTRODUCTION TO THE STANDARD MODEL (in english), QUANTUM INFORMATION (in english), MATHEMATICAL METHODS AND MODELS FOR APPLICATIONS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in humanities curriculum classic?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in humanities curriculum classic are: ITALIAN LITERATURE, GREEK HISTORY, LABORATORY, FOREIGN LANGUAGE LABORATORY - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, ELEMENTS OF ITALIAN LINGUISTICS, PRINCIPLES OF LATIN LANGUAGE AND CIVILISATION and POETRY, PROSE AND AUTHIRSHIP IN GREEK TEXTS.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in humanities curriculum classic?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in humanities curriculum classic are: CLASSICAL ARCHAEOLOGY, GLOTTOLOGY, ELEMENTS OF CLASSICAL PHILOLOGY, ITALIAN LANGUAGE AND TEXTUALITY, GREEK LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE I - INTEGRATED COURSE [GREEK LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE I - MODULE A, GREEK LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE I - MODULE B], ROMAN HISTORY and LATIN LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE I [LATIN LANGUAGE AD LITERATURE I - MODULE B, LATIN LANGUAGE AD LITERATURE I - MODULE A].

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in humanities curriculum classic?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in humanities curriculum classic are: GEOGRAPHY, LATIN LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE II and GREEK LANGUAGE AND LITERATURE II. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: MEDIEVAL HISTORY, CONTEMPORARY HISTORY, MODERN HISTORY.  A final examination is also scheduled.
