question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in philosophical and historical studies curriculum philosphical studies?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in philosophical and historical studies curriculum philosphical studies are: CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY, ELEMENTS OF PHILOSOPHY, GENERAL AND SOCIAL PEDAGOGY, ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL HISTORY  OF THE MODERN AGE, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, HISTORY OF PHILOSOPHY and CONTEMPORARY HISTORY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in philosophical and historical studies curriculum philosphical studies?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in philosophical and historical studies curriculum philosphical studies are: PHILOSOPHY OF LANGUAGE, HISTORY OF ANCIENT PHILOSOPHY, MEDIEVAL HISTORY, AESTHETICS, HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL PHILOSOPHY and MODERN HISTORY. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: GREEK HISTORY, ROMAN HISTORY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, LOGIC, INSTITUTES OF PHILOSOPHY OF SCIENCE, PHILOSOPHY AND GENDER DIFFERENCE. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, INTERNSHIP.

answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in philosophical and historical studies curriculum philosphical studies are: MORAL PHILOSOPHY, COMPUTING AND TELEMATICS SKILLS and COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: PHILOSOPHY OF RELIGIONS, HISTORY OF MODERN PHILOSOPHY, POLITICAL PHILOSOPHY, PHILOSOPHY OF TECHNIQUE, PHILOSOPHICAL HERMENEUTICS, PHILOSOPHY OF HISTORY, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PHILOSOPHY, HISTORY TEACHING METHODOLOGY.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in food communication curriculum food & wine communication (lm-gastr)?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in food communication curriculum food & wine communication (lm-gastr) are: HISTORY OF FOOD, FOOD AND WINE LANGUAGES, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, FOOD CONSUMPTION SOCIOLOGY and ETHNOGASTRONOMY. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in food communication curriculum food & wine communication (lm-gastr)?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in food communication curriculum food & wine communication (lm-gastr) are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2, MEDIA AND ENOGASTRONOMY, THEORY AND TECHNIQUE OF WINE AND FOOD TASTING, FOOD AND WINE MARKETING AND TOURISM, MEDITERRANEAN FOOS SYSTEMS AND SUPPLY CHAINS [QUALITY AGRI-FOOD SYSTEMS, MEDITERRANEAN SUPPLY CHAINS: TRADITION, CULTURE, LANDSCAPE AND FUTURE] and THEORY OF TASTE. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: BRAND SEMIOTICS, FOOD DESIGN AND PACKAGING, THEORY AND TECHNIQUES OF SERIALITY, CONSUMER SPACES SEMIOTICS, ALIMENTATION AND HEALTH, SENSORY ANALYSIS AND WINE PRODUCTION, CULTURAL HERITAGE AND FOOD AND WINE MANAGEMENT.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum kinformation and social media?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum kinformation and social media are: CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGY, GENERAL LINGUISTICS, SEMIOTICS, SOCIOLOGY OF COMMUNICATION, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET, CULTURAL STUDIES and ENGLISH LANGUAGE. optional subjects is also included.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum kinformation and social media?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum kinformation and social media are: SOCIAL STATISTICS, SOCIOLOGY OF JOURNALISM, CULTURAL HISTORY OF THE MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY AGE, COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2 and PUBLIC POLICIES. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: WRITING - WORKSHOP [TEXT AND COMMUNICATION], TEXT AND COMMUNICATION [CREATIVE WRITING], CREATIVE WRITING, JOURNALISM WORKSHOP, COMPUTER TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE WEB - WORKSHOP, VISUAL DESIGN STUDIO, QUALITATIVE SOCIOLOGY WORKSHOP [QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES], QUALITATIVE INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUE, COMINATORY LOGIC AND LIFE STORIES [METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW], METHOD, TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE OF THE JOURNALISTIC INTERVIEW, SCREENWRITING WORKSHOP, LINGUISTICS WORKSHOP [COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE], COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS MODULE [LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE], LEXICAL MORPHOLOGY MODULE, PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOP, POLITICAL COMMUNICATION WORKSHOP. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: ALBANIAN LANGUAGE, ARAB LANGUAGE, FRENCH LANGUAGE, ENGLISH LANGUAGE -ADVANCED COURSE, HEBRAIC LANGUAGE. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: AESTHETICS, SOCIOLINGUISTICS, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PHILOSOPHY, CULTURAL GEOGRAPHY, THEORY OF TRANSLATION, GENDER STUDIES, JOURNALISM AND LITERATURE, TWENTIETH CENTURY LITERATURES, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ART, HISTORY OF MUSIC, DIGITAL ETHICS, PUBLIC CONSULTATION AND PARTICIPATORY PROCESSES, IMAGE SEMIOTICS.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum kinformation and social media?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in communication sciences curriculum kinformation and social media are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, SEMIOTICS OF MEDIA, HISTORY  OF CINEMA AND CINEMA STUDIES, POLITICAL TECHNOLOGY and COMMUNICATION LAW. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: AESTHETICS, SOCIOLINGUISTICS, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY PHILOSOPHY, CULTURAL GEOGRAPHY, THEORY OF TRANSLATION, GENDER STUDIES, JOURNALISM AND LITERATURE, TWENTIETH CENTURY LITERATURES, HISTORY OF CONTEMPORARY ART, HISTORY OF MUSIC, DIGITAL ETHICS, PUBLIC CONSULTATION AND PARTICIPATORY PROCESSES, IMAGE SEMIOTICS.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in energy engineering and renewable energies curriculum technologies and production?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in energy engineering and renewable energies curriculum technologies and production are: GEOMETRY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE, MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS - INTEGRATED COURSE [MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 1, MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS - MODULE 2], PRINCIPLES OF CHEMISTRY FOR TECHNOLOGIES - INTEGRATED COURSE [TECHNOLOGY OF MATERIALS, CHEMISTRY FOR ENGINEERING], NUMERICAL ANALYSIS, COMPUTER AIDED DESIGN and PHYSICS I.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in energy engineering and renewable energies curriculum technologies and production?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in energy engineering and renewable energies curriculum technologies and production are: TECHNICAL PHYSICS, ELEMENTS OF ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING, PHYSICS II, PRINCIPLES OF RENEWABLE ENERGIES, MECHANICS OF MATERIALS AND THEORY OF STRUCTURES and ENERGETICS AND FLUID MACHINES [ENERGETICS, PROCESS MACHINERY].

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum philosophy?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum philosophy are: INTERNSHIP and ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: THEORETICAL PHILOSOPHY, PHILOSOPHY OF VERBAL PRACTICES, ETHICS, LANGUAGES AND GRAMMARS OF POWER. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: HISTORY OF HEBRAIC MEDIEVAL PHILOSOPHY,  PHILOSOPHY OF SOCIAL SCIENCES (in english), ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (ADVANCED LEVEL), ONTOLOGY AND PHENOMENOLOGY, LEGAL PHILOSOPHY, GENERAL PEDAGOGY (ADVANCED LEVEL), PHILOSOPHY OF LANGUAGE AND MIND, BIOETHICS AND PUBLIC ETHICS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VI: SOCIAL AND POLITICAL HISTORY OF ANCIENT GREECE, POLITICS AND CONFLICTS (XVII-XX CENTURIES), HISTORY OF DEMOCRATISATION PROCESSES, ANCIENT ROME SOCIAL AND POLITICAL HISTORY.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum philosophy?
answer: Subject of the second year of the master degree in philosophical and historical sciences curriculum philosophy is ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: PHILOSOPHY OF SCIENCE, METAPHYSICS, CONTEMPORARY AESTHETICS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects VIII: PHILOSOPHICAL ANTHROPOLOGY, PHILOSOPHY TEACHING METHODOLOGY [PHILOSOPHY TEACHING METHODOLOGY - MODULE A], PHILOSOPHY TEACHING METHODOLOGY - MODULE A [PHILOSOPHY TEACHING METHODOLOGY - MODULE], PHILOSOPHY TEACHING METHODOLOGY - MODULE, EPISTEMOLOGY AND ANALYTICAL PHILOSOPHY, PHILOSOPHY OF MATHEMATICS, LANGUAGE EPISTEMOLOGY, CONTEMPORARY HERMENEUTICS, HISTORY OF THE ECONOMIC AND SCIENTIFIC THOUGHT IN THE MODERN AGE, LANGUAGES, SYMBOLS AND IDENTITY.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in physics curriculum physical sciences?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in physics curriculum physical sciences are: CHEMISTRY, GEOMETRY AND ALGEBRA, PHYSICS I [FLUIDS, WAVES AND THERMODYNAMICS, MECHANICS], PHYSICS I - LABORATORY [STATISTICAL  DATA ANALYSIS WITH LABORATORY, THEORY OF ERRORS WITH LABORATORY], MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS I [SINGLE VARIABLE DIFFERENTIAL AND INTEGRAL CALCULUS, INTRODUCTORY ANALYSIS ISSUES], ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B1, ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET and PROGRAMMING METHODS FOR PHYSICS.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in physics curriculum physical sciences?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in physics curriculum physical sciences are: PHYSICS II [ELECTROMAGNETISM AND OPTICS, ELECTROSTATICS AND MAGNETISM], PHYSICS  II - LABORATORY [ELECTRICAL CIRCUITS, ELECTROMAGNETISM AND OPTICS EXPERIENCES], MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS II [DIFFERENTIAL AND INTEGRAL CALCULUS OF MORE VARIABLES, COMPLEX ANALYSIS AND DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS], ANALYTICAL AND RELATIVISTIC MECHANICS [RELATIVISTIC MECHANICS, ANALYTICAL MECHANICS] and NUMERICAL METHODS FOR PHYSICS. subject for path of excellence and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: COMPLEMENTS OF CLASSICAL PHYSICS, STEREODYNAMIC PROPERTIES OF BIOLOGICAL MATTER,FROM MACRO TO NANO-SCALE (in english), COSMOLOGY (in english), INTRODUCTION TO LASERS AND PHOTONICS (in english), ADVANCED CLASSICAL ELECTRODYNAMICS (in english), INTRODUCTION TO COSMIC RAY PHYSICS (in english), HISTORY OF PHYSICS, ADVANCED EXPERIMENTAL METHODOLOGIES (in english), ADVANCES IN MATHEMATICAL METHODS FOR PHYSICS (in english), PHYSICS AND INFORMATION (in english), MACHINE LEARNING FOR PHYSICS, INTRODUCTION TO COMPLEXITY [STOCHASTIC COMPUTATIONAL MODELS AND METHODS FOR COMPLEX SYSTEMS], STOCHASTIC COMPUTATIONAL MODELS AND METHODS FOR COMPLEX SYSTEMS [COMPUTATIONAL MODELS AND METHODS FOR COMPLEXITY], COMPUTATIONAL MODELS AND METHODS FOR COMPLEXITY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for subject for path of excellence: INTERNSHIP ACTIVITIES - EXCELLENCE PATH IN PHYSICAL SCIENCES, OTHER ACTIVITIES AND IN-DEPTH PROJECT - III YEAR - EXCELLENCE PATH IN PHYSICAL SCIENCES, OTHER ACTIVITIES AND IN-DEPTH PROJECT - II YEAR - EXCELLENCE PATH IN PHYSICAL SCIENCES, STEREODYNAMIC PROPERTIES OF BIOLOGICAL MATTER,FROM MACRO TO NANO-SCALE (in english), COSMOLOGY (in english), INTRODUCTION TO LASERS AND PHOTONICS (in english), ADVANCED CLASSICAL ELECTRODYNAMICS (in english), INTRODUCTION TO COSMIC RAY PHYSICS (in english), ADVANCED EXPERIMENTAL METHODOLOGIES (in english), ADVANCES IN MATHEMATICAL METHODS FOR PHYSICS (in english), PHYSICS AND INFORMATION (in english).

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in physics curriculum physical sciences?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in physics curriculum physical sciences are: PRACTICE, QUANTUM MECHANICS [HYDROGEN ATOM AND PERTURBATION CALCULUS, INTRODUCTION TO QUANTUM MECHANICS], COMPETENCES RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET 2, PRINCIPLES OF MATHEMATICAL METHODS FOR PHYSICS, STATISTICAL MECHANICS, ASTRONOMY, STRUCTURE OF MATTER and NUCLEAR AND PARTICLE PHYSICS. optional subjects is also included. A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in religions and cultures?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in religions and cultures are: SOURCES,, METHODS AND PRINCIPLES OF THE HISTORY OF CHRISTIANITY, SOURCES,, METHODS AND PRINCIPLES OF THE HISTORY OF CULTURE, SOURCES,, METHODS AND PRINCIPLES OF THE HISTORY OF ISLAM, GLOBAL HISTORY OF CHRISTIAN CHURCHES, SOURCES,, METHODS AND PRINCIPLES OF THE HISTORY OF RELIGIONS, SOURCES,, METHODS AND PRINCIPLES OF THE HISTORY OF EBRAISM and CROSS-SECTORAL SEMINARS: RELIGIOUS DIALOGUES. optional subjects is also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: HISTORY OF INTER-RELIGIOUS RELATIONS, ANTHROPOLOGY OF THE SACRED, GEOPOLITICS OF RELIGIONS. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: ENGLISH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2, FRENCH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2, GERMAN LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2, SPANISH LANGUAGE - LEVEL B2.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in religions and cultures?
answer: Subject of the second year of the master degree in religions and cultures is PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: HISTORY OF THEOLOGICAL DOCTRINES, HISTORY OF JUDAIC THOUGHT, FUNDAMENTAL THEOLOGY, PHILOSOPHY OF RELIGION: HISTORY AND ISSUES, SECULARIZATION THEORIES. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: HISTORY OF LITURGY, TALMUD, HISTORY OF ISLAMIC PHILOSOPHY, HISTORY OF ECCLESIOLOGICAL DOCTRINES, THEOLOGIES OF PEACE, HISTORY OF CANON LAW, DIASPORAS, IDIENTITIES AND RELIGIOUS MINORITIES, PHILOSOPHIES AND RELIGIONS OF INDIA, ANCIENT MEDITERRANEAN RELIGIONS, CULTURE OF LEGALITY AND MULTIRELIGIOUS SOCIETIES, HISTORY OF THE ISLAMIC MANUSCRIPT TRADITION. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: MEDIEVAL AND HUMANISTIC LATIN LITERATURE, HISTORY OF PEDAGOGY, ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORY OF PALAEOCHRISTIAN ART, COMPARATIVE HISTORY OF MEDIEVAL ART IN THE MEDITERRANEAN, SACRED ART: COLLECTING AND MUSEUMS, HUMAN RIGHTS IN DEVELOPMENT AND MIGRATION POLICIES.  A final examination is also scheduled.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the master degree in chemistry?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the master degree in chemistry are: ORGANIC SPECTROSCOPY, ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS - EQUIVALENT TO LEVEL B2, ADVANCED INORGANIC CHEMISTRY, ANALYTICAL DATA VALIDATION AND CHEMIOMETRY, THEORETICAL AND COMPUTATIONAL CHEMISTRY and SUPRAMOLECULAR CHEMISTRY. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects II: INNOVATIVE METHODOLOGIES IN ORGANIC CHEMISTRY, ORGANIC SPECIAL SYNTHESES AND LABORATORY, ORGANIC MATERIALS CHEMISTRY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects III: MATERIALS PREPARATION AND CHARACTERISATION, GREEN CHEMISTRY, PRINCIPLES OF CHEMISTRY TEACHING METHODOLOGY [THE FOUNDING PRINCIPLES OF CHEMISTRY AND THEIR EDUCATIONAL IMPLEMENTATION], THE FOUNDING PRINCIPLES OF CHEMISTRY AND THEIR EDUCATIONAL IMPLEMENTATION [METHODS FOR TEACHING AND LEARNING CHEMISTRY], METHODS FOR TEACHING AND LEARNING CHEMISTRY, BIOSENSORS AND ADVANCED ANALYTICAL METHOD - WITH LABORATORY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: COMPUTATIONAL METHODS IN BIOINORGANIC CHEMISTRY, ADVANCED SYNTHES IN INORGANIC CHEMISTRY - INTEGRATED COURSE [SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF ORGANOMETALLIC COMPOUNDS], SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF ORGANOMETALLIC COMPOUNDS [SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF COORDINATION COMPLEXES], SYNTHESIS AND CHARACTERIZATION OF COORDINATION COMPLEXES.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the master degree in chemistry?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the master degree in chemistry are: PRACTICE, INTERNSHIP AND PRACTICE and ADVANCED SKILLS RELATED TO THE LABOUR MARKET. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects IV: INTERPHASES PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY, PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY OF MATERIALS, METHODOLOGIES AND TOOLS IN TEACHING CHEMISTRY. It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Optional subjects V: ENVIRONMENT AND CULTURAL HERITAGE CHEMISTRY, NATURAL SUBSTANCES.  A final examination is also scheduled.

Teaching is held by professor LO BRANO. Lessons will take place during the 2° semester. For more information visit the course website http://www.unipa.it/struttura.html?id=719.

question: What are the subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum labour consulting and human resources managemen?
answer: Subjects of the first year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum labour consulting and human resources managemen are: ELEMENTS OF PUBLIC LAW, ENGLISH LANGUAGE AND TRANSLATION, PRIVATE AND DIGITAL INNOVATION LAW and THEORY AND HISTORY OF POLITICAL ECONOMICS. optional subjects and free subjects are also included.It is possible to choose among the following teachings as for Free subjects: SPORTS LAW, MODERN HISTORY, GENERAL SOCIOLOGY AND SOCIAL PLANNING.

question: What are the subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum labour consulting and human resources managemen?
answer: Subjects of the second year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum labour consulting and human resources managemen are: CRIMINAL LAW, ADMINISTRATIVE LAW, LABOUR LAW, ETHICS AND POLITICAL PHILOSOPHY, BUSINESS ECONOMICS, TAXATION LAW and MACROECONOMICS.

question: What are the subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum labour consulting and human resources managemen?
answer: Subjects of the third year of the bachelor degree in administrative science, labour consulting and social innovation curriculum labour consulting and human resources managemen are: PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE, EUROPEAN LABOUR LAW AND SOCIAL SECURITY LAW - INTEGRATED COURSE [EUROPEAN LABOUR LAW, SOCIAL SECURITY LAW], STRATEGIC HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGEMENT - INTEGRATED COURSE [HUMAN RESOURCES PROFESSIONAL LIFE CYCLE MANAGEMENT (MODULE), MODELS AND TECHNIQUES OF CORPORATE TRAINING (MODULE)], SOCIAL INNOVATION SOCIOLOGY, COMMERCIAL LAW and SOCIAL STATISTICS.  A final examination is also scheduled.
